CVE-2024-46906
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T21:51:59.830000

6 posts

In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2024.0.1, a SQL Injection vulnerability allows an authenticated low-privileged user (at least Report Viewer permissions required) to achieve privilege escalation to the admin account.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-12-03T10:14:26.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T19:14:21.854Z ##

Progress WhatsUp Gold security advisory: WhatsUp Gold Security Bulletin– September 2024??
Progress completely ignoring the norms of vulnerability disclosure by silently patching a 24 September 2024 security advisory for WhatsUp Gold and only releasing the CVE IDs when threatened by Tenable (see the timeline).

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

See Tenable research advisory for the proof of concept. h/t Bleeping Computer: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now

#progress #whatsupgold #wug #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_8785 #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-03T19:14:21.000Z ##

Progress WhatsUp Gold security advisory: WhatsUp Gold Security Bulletin– September 2024??
Progress completely ignoring the norms of vulnerability disclosure by silently patching a 24 September 2024 security advisory for WhatsUp Gold and only releasing the CVE IDs when threatened by Tenable (see the timeline).

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

See Tenable research advisory for the proof of concept. h/t Bleeping Computer: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now

CVE-2024-53672
(4.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T21:31:43

4 posts

A vulnerability in the ClearPass Policy Manager web-based management interface allows remote authenticated users to run arbitrary commands on the underlying host. Successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands as a lower privileged user on the underlying operating system.

CVE-2024-0130
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T21:30:51

2 posts

NVIDIA UFM Enterprise, UFM Appliance, and UFM CyberAI contain a vulnerability where an attacker can cause an improper authentication issue by sending a malformed request through the Ethernet management interface. A successful exploit of this vulnerability might lead to escalation of privileges, data tampering, denial of service, and information disclosure.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-12-07T05:17:38.000Z ##

CVE-2024-11680
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T21:30:38

27 posts

ProjectSend versions prior to r1720 are affected by an improper authentication vulnerability. Remote, unauthenticated attackers can exploit this flaw by sending crafted HTTP requests to options.php, enabling unauthorized modification of the application's configuration. Successful exploitation allows attackers to create accounts, upload webshells, and embed malicious JavaScript.

1 repos

https://github.com/D3N14LD15K/CVE-2024-11680_PoC_Exploit

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-12-02T12:15:03.000Z ##

CISA Releases New List of Known Exploited Vulnerabilities, Urges Immediate Actions https://cyble.com/blog/cisa-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-updated/ #KnownExploitedVulnerabilities #Vulnerability #CVE202411680 #CVE202423113 #CVE202447575 #Exploit #CISA #KEV

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.488Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T15:11:21.695Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high) Zyxel Multiple Firewalls Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-11680 (9.8 critical) ProjectSend Improper Authentication Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-45727 (7.5 high) North Grid Proself Improper Restriction of XML External Entity (XEE) Reference Vulnerability

#CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
threatcodex at 2024-12-01T20:43:47.188Z ##

ProjectSend CVE-2024-11680 Exploited in the Wild
#ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680
https://vulncheck.com/blog/projectsend-exploited-itw

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-27T16:37:29.210Z ##

VulnCheck: ProjectSend CVE-2024-11680 Exploited in the Wild
@vulncheck reports that Public-facing ProjectSend instances appear to have been exploited by attackers. CVE-2024-11680 (9.8 critical) ProjectSend Unauthenticated Configuration Modification was assigned a CVE ID just yesterday (by VulnCheck), but was reported by Synactiv and patched by ProjectSend back on 16 May 2023. No indicators shared.

cc: @todb

#projectsend #CVE_2024_11680 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.000Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-45204
(7.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T21:30:38

2 posts

A vulnerability exists where a low-privileged user can exploit insufficient permissions in credential handling to leak NTLM hashes of saved credentials. The exploitation involves using retrieved credentials to expose sensitive NTLM hashes, impacting systems beyond the initial target and potentially leading to broader security vulnerabilities.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T18:19:46.270Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Vulnerabilities Resolved in Veeam Backup & Replication 12.3

  • CVE-2024-40717 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42451 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (all saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-42452 (8.8 high) authenticated file upload privesc
  • CVE-2024-42453 (8.8 high) authenticated control/modify the configuration of connected virtual infrastructure hosts
  • CVE-2024-42455 (7.1 high) authenticated arbitrary file deletion by sending a serialized temporary file collection
  • CVE-2024-42456 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42457 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (expose saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-45204 (7.7 high) authenticated NTLM hash leak of saved credentials

No mention of exploitation but it's 2024 and Veeam still has NTLM hash vulnerabilities.

#veeam #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #PatchTuesday

CVE-2024-38832
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T21:30:38

3 posts

VMware Aria Operations contains a stored cross-site scripting vulnerability. A malicious actor with editing access to views may be able to inject malicious script leading to stored cross-site scripting in the product VMware Aria Operations.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:02:54.745Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0022: VMware Aria Operations updates address multiple vulnerabilities(CVE-2024-38830, CVE-2024-38831, CVE-2024-38832, CVE-2024-38833, CVE-2024-38834)

  • CVE-2024-38830 (7.8 high) Local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38831 (7.8 high) Local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38832 (7.1 high) Stored cross-site scripting vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38833 (6.8 medium) Stored cross-site scripting vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38834 (6.5 medium) Stored cross-site scripting vulnerability

No mention of exploitation

##

CVE-2024-51378
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T18:31:52

6 posts

getresetstatus in dns/views.py and ftp/views.py in CyberPanel (aka Cyber Panel) before 1c0c6cb allows remote attackers to bypass authentication and execute arbitrary commands via /dns/getresetstatus or /ftp/getresetstatus by bypassing secMiddleware (which is only for a POST request) and using shell metacharacters in the statusfile property, as exploited in the wild in October 2024 by PSAUX. Versio

1 repos

https://github.com/refr4g/CVE-2024-51378

screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T15:55:08.046Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CVE-2024-51378 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 @cR0w) CyberPanel Incorrect Default Permissions Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T15:55:08.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CVE-2024-51378 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 @cR0w) CyberPanel Incorrect Default Permissions Vulnerability

CVE-2024-10516
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T15:31:26

1 posts

The Swift Performance Lite plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Local PHP File Inclusion in all versions up to, and including, 2.3.7.1 via the 'ajaxify' function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to include and execute arbitrary files on the server, allowing the execution of any PHP code in those files. This can be used to bypass access controls, obtain sensitive data, or achi

Nuclei template

CVE-2024-49041
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T03:31:15

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-12-06T13:27:11.234Z ##

Microsoft security advisory 05* December 2024:

  • CVE-2024-49041 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability NEW!
  • CVE-2024-12053 Type Confusion in V8 (originally announced by Google on 03 December 2024)

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. I guess this doubles as a release notes, that Microsoft Edge is now on version 131.0.2903.86: Edge Release Notes 05 December 2024 cc: @ruario

#microsoft #edge #chrome #chromium #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-10933
(5.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T21:32:02

4 posts

In OpenBSD 7.5 before errata 009 and OpenBSD 7.4 before errata 022, exclude any '/' in readdir name validation to avoid unexpected directory traversal on untrusted file systems.

##

CVE-2024-11942
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T19:58:25

2 posts

Under certain uncommon site configurations, a bug in the CKEditor 5 module can cause some image uploads to move the entire webroot to a different location on the file system. This could be exploited by a malicious user to take down a site. The issue is mitigated by the fact that several non-default site configurations must exist simultaneously for this to occur.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-12-06T10:18:33.000Z ##

CVE-2024-11941
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T19:58:07

2 posts

The Comment module allows users to reply to comments. In certain cases, an attacker could make comment reply requests that would trigger a denial of service (DOS). Sites that do not use the Comment module are not affected.

CVE-2024-54128
(5.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T19:15:08.857000

4 posts

Directus is a real-time API and App dashboard for managing SQL database content. The Comment feature has implemented a filter to prevent users from adding restricted characters, such as HTML tags. However, this filter operates on the client-side, which can be bypassed, making the application vulnerable to HTML Injection. This vulerability is fixed in 10.13.4 and 11.2.0.

During a security audit, [Radically Open Security](https://www.radicallyopensecurity.com/) discovered two vulnerabilities which allow attackers to trigger resource exhaustion vulnerabilities in `rpgp` by providing crafted messages. ##

CVE-2024-11667
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T18:41:12.113000

46 posts

A directory traversal vulnerability in the web management interface of Zyxel ATP series firmware versions V5.00 through V5.38, USG FLEX series firmware versions V5.00 through V5.38, USG FLEX 50(W) series firmware versions V5.10 through V5.38, and USG20(W)-VPN series firmware versions V5.10 through V5.38 could allow an attacker to download or upload files via a crafted URL.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.488Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T15:11:21.695Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high) Zyxel Multiple Firewalls Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-11680 (9.8 critical) ProjectSend Improper Authentication Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-45727 (7.5 high) North Grid Proself Improper Restriction of XML External Entity (XEE) Reference Vulnerability

#CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T19:46:34.759Z ##

CCCS (Canada) security advisory: Zyxel security advisory (AV24-689)
The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security just outright said "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited."

While Zyxel's security advisory hasn't updated since 27 November 2024, and the language is ambiguous... This is an official government security advisory and CCCS could be referring to direct communication with the vendor. Patch your shit to address CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) Zyxel firewall directory traversal vulnerability. Threat actors are actively exploiting Zyxel firewalls to deploy Helldown ransomware.

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
cafuego@misanthrope.social at 2024-11-29T02:39:58.000Z ##

#CVE_2024_11667 #AUD_2981_97086

##
i0null at 2024-11-29T00:47:12.442Z ##

#CVE_2024_11667 #directoryTraversalMemes

##
i0null at 2024-11-29T00:36:04.589Z ##

This one's for you #CVE_2024_11667 :blobkissheart:

#directoryTraversalMemes

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-28T16:03:50.637Z ##

CERT Bund (Germany): Zyxel Firewalls zur Verbreitung von Ransomware missbraucht (PDF)
English translation of title: "Zyxel firewalls abused to spread ransomware" The Computer Emergency Response Team for Germany's federal authorities issued a security advisory warning that corporate networks were being infected with Helldown ransomware, and that exfiltrated information was threatened with release (double extortion). CERT-Bund explicitly states that "During the analysis, IT security researchers found that in most cases, a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls was probably exploited to carry out the attacks. However, it is still unclear what the vulnerability is in detail, and whether it is even publicly known."

Bei der Analyse fanden IT-Sicherheitsforschende heraus, dass zur Durchführung der Angriffe in den meisten Fällen vermutlich eine Schwachstelle in Zyxel Firewalls ausgenutzt wurde. Bislang ist jedoch unklar, um welche Schwachstelle es sich im Detail handelt und ob diese überhaupt öffentlich bekannt ist

CERT-Bund does not include any CVE IDs. While Sekoia and Cyfirma both allude to CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability (see parent toots above this), Zyxel's own security advisory mentions CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) a directory traversal vulnerability. cc: @todb @cR0w

View the vendor's security advisory: Zyxel security advisory: protecting against recent firewall threats

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_42057 #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-11-28T05:25:25.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2024-11667 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2024-11667/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_11667

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.000Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-28T16:03:50.000Z ##

CERT Bund (Germany): Zyxel Firewalls zur Verbreitung von Ransomware missbraucht (PDF)
English translation of title: "Zyxel firewalls abused to spread ransomware" The Computer Emergency Response Team for Germany's federal authorities issued a security advisory warning that corporate networks were being infected with Helldown ransomware, and that exfiltrated information was threatened with release (double extortion). CERT-Bund explicitly states that "During the analysis, IT security researchers found that in most cases, a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls was probably exploited to carry out the attacks. However, it is still unclear what the vulnerability is in detail, and whether it is even publicly known."

Bei der Analyse fanden IT-Sicherheitsforschende heraus, dass zur Durchführung der Angriffe in den meisten Fällen vermutlich eine Schwachstelle in Zyxel Firewalls ausgenutzt wurde. Bislang ist jedoch unklar, um welche Schwachstelle es sich im Detail handelt und ob diese überhaupt öffentlich bekannt ist

CERT-Bund does not include any CVE IDs. While Sekoia and Cyfirma both allude to CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability (see parent toots above this), Zyxel's own security advisory mentions CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) a directory traversal vulnerability. cc: @todb @cR0w

View the vendor's security advisory: Zyxel security advisory: protecting against recent firewall threats

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_42057 #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-11-28T05:25:25.000Z ##

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-29T10:25:02.000Z ##

Zyxel Firewalls Targeted by Helldown Ransomware: CVE-2024-11667 Exploited https://thecyberexpress.com/helldown-ransomware-targets-zyxel-firewalls/ #TheCyberExpressNews #Helldownransomware #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #Zyxelfirewalls #FirewallDaily #CVE202411667 #GermanCERT #CyberNews #CERTBund

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.488Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T15:11:21.695Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high) Zyxel Multiple Firewalls Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-11680 (9.8 critical) ProjectSend Improper Authentication Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-45727 (7.5 high) North Grid Proself Improper Restriction of XML External Entity (XEE) Reference Vulnerability

#CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T19:46:34.759Z ##

CCCS (Canada) security advisory: Zyxel security advisory (AV24-689)
The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security just outright said "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited."

While Zyxel's security advisory hasn't updated since 27 November 2024, and the language is ambiguous... This is an official government security advisory and CCCS could be referring to direct communication with the vendor. Patch your shit to address CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) Zyxel firewall directory traversal vulnerability. Threat actors are actively exploiting Zyxel firewalls to deploy Helldown ransomware.

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

#CVE_2024_11667 #directoryTraversalMemes

screaminggoat at 2024-11-28T16:03:50.637Z ##

CERT Bund (Germany): Zyxel Firewalls zur Verbreitung von Ransomware missbraucht (PDF)
English translation of title: "Zyxel firewalls abused to spread ransomware" The Computer Emergency Response Team for Germany's federal authorities issued a security advisory warning that corporate networks were being infected with Helldown ransomware, and that exfiltrated information was threatened with release (double extortion). CERT-Bund explicitly states that "During the analysis, IT security researchers found that in most cases, a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls was probably exploited to carry out the attacks. However, it is still unclear what the vulnerability is in detail, and whether it is even publicly known."

Bei der Analyse fanden IT-Sicherheitsforschende heraus, dass zur Durchführung der Angriffe in den meisten Fällen vermutlich eine Schwachstelle in Zyxel Firewalls ausgenutzt wurde. Bislang ist jedoch unklar, um welche Schwachstelle es sich im Detail handelt und ob diese überhaupt öffentlich bekannt ist

CERT-Bund does not include any CVE IDs. While Sekoia and Cyfirma both allude to CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability (see parent toots above this), Zyxel's own security advisory mentions CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) a directory traversal vulnerability. cc: @todb @cR0w

View the vendor's security advisory: Zyxel security advisory: protecting against recent firewall threats

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.000Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

jbhall56 at 2024-12-04T14:03:42.715Z ##

##

CVE-2024-45318
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T18:32:07

4 posts

A vulnerability in the SonicWall SMA100 SSLVPN web management interface allows remote attackers to cause Stack-based buffer overflow and potentially lead to code execution.

jbhall56 at 2024-12-06T14:40:23.391Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-45318 and CVE-2024-53703, (CVSS score of 8.1), the two issues allow remote attackers to cause stack-based buffer overflows, which could potentially lead to code execution. https://www.securityweek.com/sonicwall-patches-6-vulnerabilities-in-secure-access-gateway/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-05T12:21:09.490Z ##

SonicWall security advisory 03 December 2024: SonicWall SMA100 SSL-VPN Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-38475 (7.5 high) Path traversal vulnerability – attributed to publicly known Apache HTTP Server vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-40763 (7.5 high) SonicWALL SMA100 Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45318 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45319 (6.3 medium) Certificate-based authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-53702 (5.3 medium) Insecure randomness 🤪
  • CVE-2024-53703 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild

#sonicwall #sma #sslvpn #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-06T14:40:23.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-45318 and CVE-2024-53703, (CVSS score of 8.1), the two issues allow remote attackers to cause stack-based buffer overflows, which could potentially lead to code execution. https://www.securityweek.com/sonicwall-patches-6-vulnerabilities-in-secure-access-gateway/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-05T12:21:09.000Z ##

SonicWall security advisory 03 December 2024: SonicWall SMA100 SSL-VPN Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-38475 (7.5 high) Path traversal vulnerability – attributed to publicly known Apache HTTP Server vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-40763 (7.5 high) SonicWALL SMA100 Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45318 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45319 (6.3 medium) Certificate-based authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-53702 (5.3 medium) Insecure randomness 🤪
  • CVE-2024-53703 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild

CVE-2024-12234
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T18:31:14

4 posts

A vulnerability was found in 1000 Projects Beauty Parlour Management System 1.0. It has been classified as critical. Affected is an unknown function of the file /admin/edit-customer-detailed.php. The manipulation of the argument name leads to sql injection. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Other parameters might be affected

##

CVE-2024-12233
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T18:31:14

4 posts

A vulnerability was found in code-projects Online Notice Board up to 1.0 and classified as critical. CVE-2024-45319
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T17:15:12.040000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the SonicWall SMA100 SSLVPN firmware 10.2.1.13-72sv and earlier versions allows a remote authenticated attacker can circumvent the certificate requirement during authentication.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-05T12:21:09.490Z ##

SonicWall security advisory 03 December 2024: SonicWall SMA100 SSL-VPN Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-38475 (7.5 high) Path traversal vulnerability – attributed to publicly known Apache HTTP Server vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-40763 (7.5 high) SonicWALL SMA100 Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45318 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45319 (6.3 medium) Certificate-based authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-53702 (5.3 medium) Insecure randomness 🤪
  • CVE-2024-53703 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild

#sonicwall #sma #sslvpn #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-12230
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T15:31:08

2 posts

A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in PHPGurukul Complaint Management System 1.0. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /admin/subcategory.php. The manipulation of the argument category leads to sql injection. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2024-45841
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T12:31:34

12 posts

Incorrect permission assignment for critical resource issue exists in UD-LT1 firmware Ver.2.1.8 and earlier and UD-LT1/EX firmware Ver.2.1.8 and earlier. If an attacker with the guest account of the affected products accesses a specific file, the information containing credentials may be obtained.

This relates to CVE-2024-45841, CVE-2024-47133, and CVE-2024-52564.

I-O Data Confirms Zero-Day Attacks on Routers, Full Patches Pending https://www.securityweek.com/i-o-data-confirms-zero-day-attacks-on-routers-full-patches-pending/ @SecurityWeek #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T15:02:28.708Z ##

Unpatched and Exploited Zero-Days: Multiple vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers UD-LT1 and UD-LT1/EX
Two different sets of researchers reported vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers to JPCERT/CC.

  • CVE-2024-45841 (6.5 medium) Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
  • CVE-2024-47133 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  • CVE-2024-52564 (7.5 high) Inclusion of Undocumented Features

The developer states that attacks exploiting these vulnerabilities have been observed.

The developer states that the updates addressing these vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-45841, CVE-2024-47133) are planned to be released around December 18, 2024. Too early to speculate and no additional information provided.

cc: @cR0w @mttaggart @ntkramer @dreadpir8robots @neurovagrant @goatyell @metacurity (remember to remove the mentions to avoid ReplyAll madness)

#vulnerability #jpcertcc #cve #IODATA #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-05T17:48:18.000Z ##

This relates to CVE-2024-45841, CVE-2024-47133, and CVE-2024-52564.

I-O Data Confirms Zero-Day Attacks on Routers, Full Patches Pending https://www.securityweek.com/i-o-data-confirms-zero-day-attacks-on-routers-full-patches-pending/ @SecurityWeek #cybersecurity #infosec

Unpatched and Exploited Zero-Days: Multiple vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers UD-LT1 and UD-LT1/EX
Two different sets of researchers reported vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers to JPCERT/CC.

  • CVE-2024-45841 (6.5 medium) Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
  • CVE-2024-47133 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  • CVE-2024-52564 (7.5 high) Inclusion of Undocumented Features

##

CVE-2024-42455
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T11:15:04.533000

2 posts

A vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication allows a low-privileged user to connect to remoting services and exploit insecure deserialization by sending a serialized temporary file collection. This exploit allows the attacker to delete any file on the system with service account privileges. The vulnerability is caused by an insufficient blacklist during the deserialization process.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T18:19:46.270Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Vulnerabilities Resolved in Veeam Backup & Replication 12.3

  • CVE-2024-40717 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42451 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (all saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-42452 (8.8 high) authenticated file upload privesc
  • CVE-2024-42453 (8.8 high) authenticated control/modify the configuration of connected virtual infrastructure hosts
  • CVE-2024-42455 (7.1 high) authenticated arbitrary file deletion by sending a serialized temporary file collection
  • CVE-2024-42456 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42457 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (expose saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-45204 (7.7 high) authenticated NTLM hash leak of saved credentials

No mention of exploitation but it's 2024 and Veeam still has NTLM hash vulnerabilities.

#veeam #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #PatchTuesday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-03T18:19:46.000Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Vulnerabilities Resolved in Veeam Backup & Replication 12.3

  • CVE-2024-40717 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42451 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (all saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-42452 (8.8 high) authenticated file upload privesc
  • CVE-2024-42453 (8.8 high) authenticated control/modify the configuration of connected virtual infrastructure hosts
  • CVE-2024-42455 (7.1 high) authenticated arbitrary file deletion by sending a serialized temporary file collection
  • CVE-2024-42456 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42457 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (expose saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-45204 (7.7 high) authenticated NTLM hash leak of saved credentials

##

CVE-2024-52564
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T10:31:40.663000

12 posts

Inclusion of undocumented features or chicken bits issue exists in UD-LT1 firmware Ver.2.1.8 and earlier and UD-LT1/EX firmware Ver.2.1.8 and earlier. A remote attacker may disable the firewall function of the affected products. As a result, an arbitrary OS command may be executed and/or configuration settings of the device may be altered.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T15:02:28.708Z ##

Unpatched and Exploited Zero-Days: Multiple vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers UD-LT1 and UD-LT1/EX
Two different sets of researchers reported vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers to JPCERT/CC.

  • CVE-2024-45841 (6.5 medium) Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
  • CVE-2024-47133 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  • CVE-2024-52564 (7.5 high) Inclusion of Undocumented Features

The developer states that attacks exploiting these vulnerabilities have been observed.

The developer states that the updates addressing these vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-45841, CVE-2024-47133) are planned to be released around December 18, 2024. Too early to speculate and no additional information provided.

##

CVE-2024-47133
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T10:31:40.430000

12 posts

UD-LT1 firmware Ver.2.1.8 and earlier and UD-LT1/EX firmware Ver.2.1.8 and earlier allow a remote authenticated attacker with an administrative account to execute arbitrary OS commands.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-12-05T17:40:02.000Z ##

AAKL at 2024-12-05T17:48:18.956Z ##

This relates to CVE-2024-45841, CVE-2024-47133, and CVE-2024-52564.

I-O Data Confirms Zero-Day Attacks on Routers, Full Patches Pending https://www.securityweek.com/i-o-data-confirms-zero-day-attacks-on-routers-full-patches-pending/ @SecurityWeek #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T15:02:28.708Z ##

Unpatched and Exploited Zero-Days: Multiple vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers UD-LT1 and UD-LT1/EX
Two different sets of researchers reported vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers to JPCERT/CC.

  • CVE-2024-45841 (6.5 medium) Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
  • CVE-2024-47133 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  • CVE-2024-52564 (7.5 high) Inclusion of Undocumented Features

The developer states that attacks exploiting these vulnerabilities have been observed.

The developer states that the updates addressing these vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-45841, CVE-2024-47133) are planned to be released around December 18, 2024. Too early to speculate and no additional information provided.

cc: @cR0w @mttaggart @ntkramer @dreadpir8robots @neurovagrant @goatyell @metacurity (remember to remove the mentions to avoid ReplyAll madness)

#vulnerability #jpcertcc #cve #IODATA #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

Unpatched and Exploited Zero-Days: Multiple vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers UD-LT1 and UD-LT1/EX
Two different sets of researchers reported vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers to JPCERT/CC.

  • CVE-2024-45841 (6.5 medium) Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
  • CVE-2024-47133 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  • CVE-2024-52564 (7.5 high) Inclusion of Undocumented Features

The developer states that attacks exploiting these vulnerabilities have been observed.

The developer states that the updates addressing these vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-45841, CVE-2024-47133) are planned to be released around December 18, 2024. Too early to speculate and no additional information provided.

(3.5 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T00:35:05

2 posts

A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in DedeCMS 5.7.116. Affected is an unknown function of the file /member/article_add.php. The manipulation of the argument body leads to cross site scripting. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2024-53259
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-04T22:16:40

4 posts

### Impact An off-path attacker can inject an ICMP Packet Too Large packet. Since affected quic-go versions used `IP_PMTUDISC_DO`, the kernel would then return a "message too large" error on `sendmsg`, i.e. when quic-go attempts to send a packet that exceeds the MTU claimed in that ICMP packet. By setting this value to smaller than 1200 bytes (the minimum MTU for QUIC), the attacker can disrupt a

1 repos

https://github.com/kota-yata/cve-2024-53259

##

CVE-2024-42452
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-04T18:33:40

2 posts

A vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication allows a low-privileged user to start an agent remotely in server mode and obtain credentials, effectively escalating privileges to system-level access. This allows the attacker to upload files to the server with elevated privileges. The vulnerability exists because remote calls bypass permission checks, leading to full system compromise.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T18:19:46.270Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Vulnerabilities Resolved in Veeam Backup & Replication 12.3

  • CVE-2024-40717 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42451 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (all saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-42452 (8.8 high) authenticated file upload privesc
  • CVE-2024-42453 (8.8 high) authenticated control/modify the configuration of connected virtual infrastructure hosts
  • CVE-2024-42455 (7.1 high) authenticated arbitrary file deletion by sending a serialized temporary file collection
  • CVE-2024-42456 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42457 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (expose saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-45204 (7.7 high) authenticated NTLM hash leak of saved credentials

No mention of exploitation but it's 2024 and Veeam still has NTLM hash vulnerabilities.

#veeam #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #PatchTuesday

A vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication platform allows a low-privileged user with a specific role to exploit a method that updates critical configuration settings, such as modifying the trusted client certificate used for authentication on a specific port. This can result in unauthorized access, enabling the user to call privileged methods and initiate critical services. The issue arises du

1 repos

#search_error

  • CVE-2024-45204 (7.7 high) authenticated NTLM hash leak of saved credentials

No mention of exploitation but it's 2024 and Veeam still has NTLM hash vulnerabilities.

#veeam #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #PatchTuesday

CVE-2024-40717
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-04T03:31:22

2 posts

A vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication allows a low-privileged user with certain roles to perform remote code execution (RCE) by updating existing jobs. These jobs can be configured to run pre- and post-scripts, which can be located on a network share and are executed with elevated privileges by default. The user can update a job and schedule it to run almost immediately, allowing arbitrary

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T18:19:46.270Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Vulnerabilities Resolved in Veeam Backup & Replication 12.3

  • CVE-2024-40717 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42451 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (all saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-42452 (8.8 high) authenticated file upload privesc
  • CVE-2024-42453 (8.8 high) authenticated control/modify the configuration of connected virtual infrastructure hosts
  • CVE-2024-42455 (7.1 high) authenticated arbitrary file deletion by sending a serialized temporary file collection
  • CVE-2024-42456 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42457 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (expose saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-45204 (7.7 high) authenticated NTLM hash leak of saved credentials

No mention of exploitation but it's 2024 and Veeam still has NTLM hash vulnerabilities.

#veeam #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #PatchTuesday

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T18:51:46.592Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google Chrome updated to version 131.0.6778.108/.109 for Windows, Mac and 131.0.6778.108 for Linux. It includes 4 security fixes, 1 externally reported: CVE-2024-12053 (high) Type Confusion in V8. No mention of exploitation.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-03T18:51:46.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google Chrome updated to version 131.0.6778.108/.109 for Windows, Mac and 131.0.6778.108 for Linux. It includes 4 security fixes, 1 externally reported: CVE-2024-12053 (high) Type Confusion in V8. No mention of exploitation.

cc: @ruario

#chrome #google #chromium #infosec #cybersecurity #CVE_2024_12053

screaminggoat at 2024-12-06T13:27:11.234Z ##

Microsoft security advisory 05* December 2024:

  • CVE-2024-49041 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability NEW!
  • CVE-2024-12053 Type Confusion in V8 (originally announced by Google on 03 December 2024)

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. I guess this doubles as a release notes, that Microsoft Edge is now on version 131.0.2903.86: Edge Release Notes 05 December 2024 cc: @ruario

#microsoft #edge #chrome #chromium #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T19:14:21.854Z ##

Progress WhatsUp Gold security advisory: WhatsUp Gold Security Bulletin– September 2024??
Progress completely ignoring the norms of vulnerability disclosure by silently patching a 24 September 2024 security advisory for WhatsUp Gold and only releasing the CVE IDs when threatened by Tenable (see the timeline).

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

See Tenable research advisory for the proof of concept. h/t Bleeping Computer: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now

#progress #whatsupgold #wug #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_8785 #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-03T19:14:21.000Z ##

Progress WhatsUp Gold security advisory: WhatsUp Gold Security Bulletin– September 2024??
Progress completely ignoring the norms of vulnerability disclosure by silently patching a 24 September 2024 security advisory for WhatsUp Gold and only releasing the CVE IDs when threatened by Tenable (see the timeline).

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

See Tenable research advisory for the proof of concept. h/t Bleeping Computer: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now

#progress #whatsupgold #wug #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_8785 #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-39890
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-03T18:32:08

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Samsung Mobile Processor, Wearable Processor, and Modem Exynos 9820, 9825, 980, 990, 850, 1080, 2100, 1280, 2200, 1330, 1380, 1480, 2400, 9110, W920, W930, W1000, Modem 5123, Modem 5300. The baseband software does not properly check the length specified by the CC (Call Control). This can lead to an Out-of-Bounds write.

CVE-2024-53981
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-02T21:37:05

4 posts

### Summary When parsing form data, `python-multipart` skips line breaks (CR `\r` or LF `\n`) in front of the first boundary and any tailing bytes after the last boundary. This happens one byte at a time and emits a log event each time, which may cause excessive logging for certain inputs. An attacker could abuse this by sending a malicious request with lots of data before the first or after the

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T19:14:21.854Z ##

Progress WhatsUp Gold security advisory: WhatsUp Gold Security Bulletin– September 2024??
Progress completely ignoring the norms of vulnerability disclosure by silently patching a 24 September 2024 security advisory for WhatsUp Gold and only releasing the CVE IDs when threatened by Tenable (see the timeline).

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

See Tenable research advisory for the proof of concept. h/t Bleeping Computer: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now

#progress #whatsupgold #wug #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_8785 #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-8785
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-02T15:15:12.380000

8 posts

In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2024.0.1, a remote unauthenticated attacker could leverage NmAPI.exe to create or change an existing registry value in registry path HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Ipswitch\.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T19:14:21.854Z ##

Progress WhatsUp Gold security advisory: WhatsUp Gold Security Bulletin– September 2024??

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

Progress WhatsUp Gold security advisory: WhatsUp Gold Security Bulletin– September 2024??
Progress completely ignoring the norms of vulnerability disclosure by silently patching a 24 September 2024 security advisory for WhatsUp Gold and only releasing the CVE IDs when threatened by Tenable (see the timeline).

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

See Tenable research advisory for the proof of concept. h/t Bleeping Computer: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now

#progress #whatsupgold #wug #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_8785 #infosec #cybersecurity

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-12-03T10:13:26.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2024-8785 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2024-8785/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_8785

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T19:14:21.854Z ##

Progress completely ignoring the norms of vulnerability disclosure by silently patching a 24 September 2024 security advisory for WhatsUp Gold and only releasing the CVE IDs when threatened by Tenable (see the timeline).

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection

  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

2 posts

A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in code-projects Farmacia 1.0. This affects an unknown part of the file /visualizar-produto.php. The manipulation of the argument id leads to sql injection. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2024-49804
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-29T18:34:10

2 posts

IBM Security Verify Access Appliance 10.0.0 through 10.0.8 could allow a locally authenticated non-administrative user to escalate their privileges due to unnecessary permissions used to perform certain tasks.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T19:20:13.116Z ##

IBM security advisory: Security Bulletin: Multiple Security Vulnerabilities were found in IBM Security Verify Access Appliance. (CVE-2024-49803, CVE-2024-49804, CVE-2024-49805, CVE-2024-49806)
"The IBM Security Verify Access appliance provides access and authentication management for user to web application sessions." (@cR0w this seems very similar to IdentityIQ's purpose innit?)

  • CVE-2024-49803 (9.8 critical) remote code execution vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49805 (9.4 critical) hardcoded credentials vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49806 (9.4 critical) hardcoded credentials vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49804 (7.8 high) privilege escalation vulnerability

Leave it to a network security policy management solution to have hardcoded credentials. h/t: @xtrc

#IBM #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-3400
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.48%

updated 2024-11-29T16:47:54.893000

1 posts

A command injection as a result of arbitrary file creation vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. Cloud NGFW, Panorama appliances, and Prisma Access are not impacted by this vulnerability.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T01:40:09.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @h4sh @todb From start of the year until now, a lot of software vendors have tried their darnedest to keep the zero-day exploitation under wraps until they released patches:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti with CVE-2023-46805 (NO PATCHES) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Google Chrome with CVE-2024-0519 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

...I FORGOT HOW CRAZY JANUARY WAS

I'd type more but the ones that stand out were Ivanti, Palo Alto Networks (CVE-2024-3400) and Cisco (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) for confirming unpatched exploited zero-days.

##

CVE-2024-9474
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.51%

updated 2024-11-29T16:15:11.400000

7 posts

A privilege escalation vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software allows a PAN-OS administrator with access to the management web interface to perform actions on the firewall with root privileges. Cloud NGFW and Prisma Access are not impacted by this vulnerability.

🔗 WatchTowr Labs Deep Dive on the subject: https://labs.watchtowr.com/pots-and-pans-aka-an-sslvpn-palo-alto-pan-os-cve-2024-0012-and-cve-2024-9474/

##
h4sh@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T01:41:05.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @screaminggoat @todb That's pretty much what happened with the recent Palo Alto unauthenticated RCE activity. They first published their own security advisory (PAN-SA-2024-0015) that's not a CVE, told customers to remove internet access to the management interface, and then figured out details for CVEs and published it in the next few days. It turned out be two different vulns (CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474)

The turnaround between active exploitation (exploit sold on forums, around Oct 31) and the CVEs assigned (19 Nov) was roughly 20 days. I believe that was an honest effort on behalf of palo (they didn't try to cover it), but it was still a bit too long

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-24T15:27:52.000Z ##

@nopatience

TAG-110, a Russia-aligned group, conducted extensive cyber-espionage campaigns across Asia and Europe using HATVIBE and CHERRYSPY malware

Virus Bulletin wrote "TAG-110 overlaps with UAC-0063, which CERT-UA attributes with moderate confidence to the Russian espionage group BlueDelta (APT28)."

For your Critical Infrastructure section, dunno if you covered this in the previous week, but the Environmental Protection Agency's Office of the Inspector General had a report on 13 November about a "passive assessment of cybersecurity vulnerabilities conducted on drinking water systems with populations served of 50,000 people or greater." https://www.epaoig.gov/reports/other/management-implication-report-cybersecurity-concerns-related-drinking-water-systems

Palo Alto Networks was actually a 2 week long saga of from unconfirmed RCE rumors to zero-day exploitation of a two-bug chain:

  • "Palo Alto Networks is aware of a claim of a remote code execution vulnerability via the PAN-OS management interface." https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/PAN-SA-2024-0015 on 08 November leading to
  • "Palo Alto Networks has observed threat activity exploiting an unauthenticated remote command execution vulnerability against a limited number of firewall management interfaces which are exposed to the Internet." on 14 November
  • indicators of compromise on 15 November
  • https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-0012 and https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-9474 on 18 November 2024 with Unit 42 advisory with IOC https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cve-2024-0012-cve-2024-9474/ and U.S. CISA adding them to the KEV catalog https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/11/07/cisa-adds-four-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog
  • vulnerability analysis and nuclei template from watchTowr on 19 November https://labs.watchtowr.com/pots-and-pans-aka-an-sslvpn-palo-alto-pan-os-cve-2024-0012-and-cve-2024-9474/
  • further updates from Unit 42 on 21 November and new IOC from Arctic Wolf on 22 November https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog-uk/threat-campaign-targeting-palo-alto-networks-firewall-devices/
##

CVE-2024-0012
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.19%

updated 2024-11-29T16:15:08.167000

9 posts

An authentication bypass in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an unauthenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to gain PAN-OS administrator privileges to perform administrative actions, tamper with the configuration, or exploit other authenticated privilege escalation vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-9474 https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-9474 .

##
h4sh@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T01:41:05.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @screaminggoat @todb That's pretty much what happened with the recent Palo Alto unauthenticated RCE activity. They first published their own security advisory (PAN-SA-2024-0015) that's not a CVE, told customers to remove internet access to the management interface, and then figured out details for CVEs and published it in the next few days. It turned out be two different vulns (CVE-2024-0012 and CVE-2024-9474)

The turnaround between active exploitation (exploit sold on forums, around Oct 31) and the CVEs assigned (19 Nov) was roughly 20 days. I believe that was an honest effort on behalf of palo (they didn't try to cover it), but it was still a bit too long

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-24T15:27:52.000Z ##

@nopatience

TAG-110, a Russia-aligned group, conducted extensive cyber-espionage campaigns across Asia and Europe using HATVIBE and CHERRYSPY malware

Virus Bulletin wrote "TAG-110 overlaps with UAC-0063, which CERT-UA attributes with moderate confidence to the Russian espionage group BlueDelta (APT28)."

For your Critical Infrastructure section, dunno if you covered this in the previous week, but the Environmental Protection Agency's Office of the Inspector General had a report on 13 November about a "passive assessment of cybersecurity vulnerabilities conducted on drinking water systems with populations served of 50,000 people or greater." https://www.epaoig.gov/reports/other/management-implication-report-cybersecurity-concerns-related-drinking-water-systems

Palo Alto Networks was actually a 2 week long saga of from unconfirmed RCE rumors to zero-day exploitation of a two-bug chain:

  • "Palo Alto Networks is aware of a claim of a remote code execution vulnerability via the PAN-OS management interface." https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/PAN-SA-2024-0015 on 08 November leading to
  • "Palo Alto Networks has observed threat activity exploiting an unauthenticated remote command execution vulnerability against a limited number of firewall management interfaces which are exposed to the Internet." on 14 November
  • indicators of compromise on 15 November
  • https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-0012 and https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2024-9474 on 18 November 2024 with Unit 42 advisory with IOC https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cve-2024-0012-cve-2024-9474/ and U.S. CISA adding them to the KEV catalog https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/11/07/cisa-adds-four-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

CVE-2024-36401
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.68%

updated 2024-11-29T15:32:24.923000

2 posts

GeoServer is an open source server that allows users to share and edit geospatial data. Prior to versions 2.23.6, 2.24.4, and 2.25.2, multiple OGC request parameters allow Remote Code Execution (RCE) by unauthenticated users through specially crafted input against a default GeoServer installation due to unsafely evaluating property names as XPath expressions. The GeoTools library API that GeoServ

CVE-2024-54004
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-27T20:12:14

2 posts

Jenkins Filesystem List Parameter Plugin 0.0.14 and earlier does not restrict the path used for the File system objects list Parameter. This allows attackers with Item/Configure permission to enumerate file names on the Jenkins controller file system. Filesystem List Parameter Plugin 0.0.15 ensures that paths used by the File system objects list Parameter are restricted to an allow list, with th

screaminggoat at 2024-11-27T18:41:55.401Z ##

Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-11-27

  • CVE-2024-47855 (7.5 high) Denial of service vulnerability in bundled json-lib
  • CVE-2024-54003 (8.0 high) Stored XSS vulnerability in Simple Queue Plugin
  • CVE-2024-54004 (4.3 medium) Path traversal vulnerability in Filesystem List Parameter Plugin cc: @cR0w

No mention of exploitation.

updated 2024-11-27T19:49:05

Jenkins Simple Queue Plugin 1.4.4 and earlier does not escape the view name. This results in a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exploitable by attackers with View/Create permission. Simple Queue Plugin 1.4.5 escapes the view name.

CVE-2024-42327
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-27T12:31:59

5 posts

A non-admin user account on the Zabbix frontend with the default User role, or with any other role that gives API access can exploit this vulnerability. An SQLi exists in the CUser class in the addRelatedObjects function, this function is being called from the CUser.get function which is available for every user who has API access.

3 repos

https://github.com/depers-rus/CVE-2024-42327

https://github.com/compr00t/CVE-2024-42327

https://github.com/aramosf/cve-2024-42327

decio at 2024-12-02T14:28:49.464Z ##

⚠️ Si vous utilisez la solution de monitoring Zabbix : Mise à jour urgente nécessaire.

Une vulnérabilité critique (CVE-2024-42327) a été détectée dans Zabbix, un outil de surveillance réseau et applicatif open-source.
Cette faille SQL Injection (9.9/10 CVSSv3) peut permettre une compromission totale du système.

👤 Les utilisateurs ayant un accès API, même non-admins, peuvent exploiter cette faille via la fonction CUser.get.

🎯 Versions affectées :

6.0.0 à 6.0.31
6.4.0 à 6.4.16
7.0.0

SQLi est une faille vieille de plusieurs décennies, simple à exploiter et fréquemment associée à des attaques comme les ransomwares ou les vols de données massifs (exemple MOVEit : 96M de personnes impactées).
⬇️

SQL injection in user.get API (CVE-2024-42327)
👇
https://support.zabbix.com/browse/ZBX-25623

[dans les news infosec]
⬇️
"Zabbix urges upgrades after critical SQL injection bug disclosure"
"US agencies blasted 'unforgivable' SQLi flaws earlier this year"
👇
https://www.theregister.com/2024/11/29/zabbix_urges_upgrades_after_critical/

#CyberVeille #Zabbix #CVE_2024_42327

CVE-2024-5921(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-27T06:30:45

12 posts

An insufficient certification validation issue in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app enables attackers to connect the GlobalProtect app to arbitrary servers. This can enable a local non-administrative operating system user or an attacker on the same subnet to install malicious root certificates on the endpoint and subsequently install malicious software signed by the malicious root certifica

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T18:25:31.906Z ##

@Xavier yes, vulnerability details were publicly disclosed by AmberWolf at SANS HackFest Hollywood on 28 October 2024 before the patch and security advisory were made yesterday:

  • https://www.sans.org/blog/a-visual-summary-of-sans-hackfest-summit-2024/
  • https://blog.amberwolf.com/blog/2024/november/palo-alto-globalprotect---code-execution-and-privilege-escalation-via-malicious-vpn-server-cve-2024-5921/
  • https://blog.amberwolf.com/blog/2024/november/introducing-nachovpn---one-vpn-server-to-pwn-them-all/
##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T18:00:11.808Z ##

AmberWolf: Palo Alto GlobalProtect - RCE and Privilege Escalation via Malicious VPN Server (CVE-2024-5921)
Apparently AmberWolf was the source of "a publicly available conference talk discussing this issue" that Palo Alto Networks was aware of. AmberWolf presented vulnerability details at SANS HackFest Hollywood on 28 October 2024. Based on a review of their vulnerability disclosure timeline, Palo Alto Networks dilly-dallied for four months past the deadline when they should have locked in (before 14 July 2024). Of course AmberWolf is going to share the vulnerability details, but here is a blog version with the technical analysis of CVE-2024-5921. cc: @cR0w since both the blog posts about Palo Alto Networks and SonicWall are related. also @hrbrmstr

See related blog post Introducing NachoVPN: One VPN Server to Pwn Them All.

#proofofconcept #CVE_2024_5921 #paloaltonetworks #vulnerability #zeroday #globalprotect #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T17:48:36.872Z ##

AmberWolf: SonicWall NetExtender for Windows - RCE as SYSTEM via EPC Client Update (CVE-2024-29014)
Reference: CVE-2024-29014 (7.1 high, disclosed 17 July 2024 by SonicWall) SonicWall NetExtender for Windows remote code execution vulnerability

An attacker could convince a user to connect their NetExtender client to a malicious VPN server. The attacker can then deliver a fake EPC Client update signed with a valid (but potentially compromised or purchased) code-signing certificate. This results in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges.

cc: @cR0w this sounds like the Palo Alto Networks one 🤔 . They provide vulnerability details for CVE-2024-29014 and a proof of concept called NachoVPN, which is a tool that demonstrates exploitation of SSL-VPN clients using a rogue VPN server.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_29014 #info #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-26T16:35:03.000Z ##

Researchers reveal exploitable flaws in corporate VPN clients https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/11/26/vulnerabilities-corporate-vpn-clients-cve-2024-5921-cve-2024-29014/ #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #AmberWolf #SonicWall #Hotstuff #Windows #macOS #News #CVE #VPN

##
hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-11-26T08:52:02.000Z ##

CVESky — https://cvesky.labs.greynoise.io/ — surfaced CVE-2024-5921 (another Palo priv. escal.) & showed Bluesky folks shared solid info on it ahead of metadata getting into major CVE platforms (likely due to NVD still being on life support). Scroll down in the free Feedly link for more stores,
1/2

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T04:36:36.638Z ##

Palo Alto Networks publicly disclosed vulnerability (zero-day): CVE-2024-5921 GlobalProtect App: Insufficient Certificate Validation Leads to Privilege Escalation
CVE-2024-5921 (CVSSv4: 5.6 medium) An insufficient certification validation issue in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app enables attackers to connect the GlobalProtect app to arbitrary servers. This can enable an attacker to install malicious root certificates on the endpoint and subsequently install malicious software signed by the malicious root certificates on that endpoint.

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue. We are aware of a publicly available conference talk discussing this issue.

#CVE_2024_5921 #paloaltonetworks #vulnerability #zeroday #globalprotect #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
