##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T17:48:36.000Z ##

AmberWolf: SonicWall NetExtender for Windows - RCE as SYSTEM via EPC Client Update (CVE-2024-29014)
Reference: CVE-2024-29014 (7.1 high, disclosed 17 July 2024 by SonicWall) SonicWall NetExtender for Windows remote code execution vulnerability

An attacker could convince a user to connect their NetExtender client to a malicious VPN server. The attacker can then deliver a fake EPC Client update signed with a valid (but potentially compromised or purchased) code-signing certificate. This results in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges.

cc: @cR0w this sounds like the Palo Alto Networks one 🤔 . They provide vulnerability details for CVE-2024-29014 and a proof of concept called NachoVPN, which is a tool that demonstrates exploitation of SSL-VPN clients using a rogue VPN server.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_29014 #info #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-26T16:35:03.000Z ##

Researchers reveal exploitable flaws in corporate VPN clients https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/11/26/vulnerabilities-corporate-vpn-clients-cve-2024-5921-cve-2024-29014/ #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #AmberWolf #SonicWall #Hotstuff #Windows #macOS #News #CVE #VPN

##
hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-11-26T08:52:02.000Z ##

CVESky — https://cvesky.labs.greynoise.io/ — surfaced CVE-2024-5921 (another Palo priv. escal.) & showed Bluesky folks shared solid info on it ahead of metadata getting into major CVE platforms (likely due to NVD still being on life support). Scroll down in the free Feedly link for more stores,
1/2

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T04:36:36.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks publicly disclosed vulnerability (zero-day): CVE-2024-5921 GlobalProtect App: Insufficient Certificate Validation Leads to Privilege Escalation
CVE-2024-5921 (CVSSv4: 5.6 medium) An insufficient certification validation issue in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app enables attackers to connect the GlobalProtect app to arbitrary servers. This can enable an attacker to install malicious root certificates on the endpoint and subsequently install malicious software signed by the malicious root certificates on that endpoint.

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue. We are aware of a publicly available conference talk discussing this issue.

#CVE_2024_5921 #paloaltonetworks #vulnerability #zeroday #globalprotect #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-49035
(8.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-26T21:32:31

8 posts

An improper access control vulnerability in Partner.Microsoft.com allows an a unauthenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-01T14:46:43.332Z ##

@zackwhittaker

  • did you already mention the Microsoft zero-day CVE-2024-49035? I think everyone missed that this week https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-49035
  • what timeframe is your week in security? RomCom exploited two different zero-days earlier this year and the details were published Tuesday: https://www.welivesecurity.com/en/eset-research/romcom-exploits-firefox-and-windows-zero-days-in-the-wild/
  • do you have a focus on vulnerabilities? a lot of software vendors published security advisories on Tuesday/Wednesday: Zyxel, Microsoft, Jenkins, Splunk, GitLab, Mozilla, VMware, Palo Alto Networks
  • Speaking of Palo Alto, https://blog.amberwolf.com/blog/2024/november/introducing-nachovpn---one-vpn-server-to-pwn-them-all/
  • EUROPOL arrests involving SKY ECC https://www.europol.europa.eu/media-press/newsroom/news/violent-albanian-criminal-group-linked-to-corruption-disrupted-sky-ecc-analysis and https://www.cbc.ca/newsinteractives/features/the-crime-messenger
##
jbhall56 at 2024-11-29T15:15:52.451Z ##

The vulnerability that has been tagged with an "Exploitation Detected" assessment is CVE-2024-49035 (CVSS score: 8.7), a privilege escalation flaw in partner[.]microsoft[.]com. https://thehackernews.com/2024/11/microsoft-fixes-ai-cloud-and-erp.html

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-28T16:33:40.572Z ##

Microsoft updated CVE-2024-49035 (8.7 high) Partner.Microsoft.Com Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability to an EXPLOITED ZERO-DAY! 🥳😂👌 Happy Thanksgiving 🦃

Microsoft messed up again and had to correct their advisory. They had an "Exploitation Detected" flag but not an "Exploited" flag when this CVE was first announced.

@ekovacs reads my toots 👀. See Security Week article Microsoft Patches Exploited Vulnerability in Partner Network Website

#microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity #copilot #dynamics365 #azure #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_49035

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T20:17:26.030Z ##

Microsoft: "we had one #PatchTuesday yes, but what about second Patch Tuesday?"

  • CVE-2024-49053 (7.6 high) Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49035 (8.7 high) Partner.Microsoft.Com Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITATION DETECTED 🚩)
  • CVE-2024-49038 (9.3 critical) Microsoft Copilot Studio Elevation Of Privilege Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49052 (8.2 high) Microsoft Azure PolicyWatch Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

Only CVE-2024-49053 has any substantial information in their FAQ section. CVE-2024-49035 is "not exploited" but "exploitation detected" 🤔 (analyst comment: likely a gaffe). The rest are Not Exploited, Not Publicly Disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity #copilot #dynamics365 #azure

##

CVE-2024-9680
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.31%

updated 2024-11-26T19:53:56.537000

8 posts

An attacker was able to achieve code execution in the content process by exploiting a use-after-free in Animation timelines. We have had reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 131.0.2, Firefox ESR < 128.3.1, Firefox ESR < 115.16.1, Thunderbird < 131.0.1, Thunderbird < 128.3.1, and Thunderbird < 115.16.0.

1 repos

https://github.com/tdonaworth/Firefox-CVE-2024-9680

aimainainu@mastodon-japan.net at 2024-11-27T22:49:35.000Z ##

#Firefox と #Windows の #ゼロデイ を #ロシアハッカー #RomCom が #悪用 : CVE-2024-9680、CVE-2024-49039 | Codebook｜Security News
ただ、その時点ではどの脅威アクターがどんな標的を狙った攻撃 ... インテリジェンス要件定義に関するガイドブック：『要件主導型インテリジェンスプログラムの ...
https://codebook.machinarecord.com/threatreport/36001/

##
st1nger at 2024-11-27T17:02:56.336Z ##

#ESET Research details the analysis of a previously unknown vulnerability in #Mozilla products exploited in the wild. This critical vulnerability, assigned CVE-2024-9680 with a CVSS score of 9.8, allows vulnerable versions of #Firefox, #Thunderbird, and the #Tor Browser to execute code in the restricted context of the browser https://www.welivesecurity.com/en/eset-research/romcom-exploits-firefox-and-windows-zero-days-in-the-wild/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:12:39.164Z ##

ESET Research RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild
ESET provides background information behind the Mozilla products zero-day CVE-2024-9680, stating that it was exploited in the wild by Russia-aligned group RomCom (aka Storm-0978, Tropical Scorpius, or UNC2596) since at least 08 October 2024. During the vulnerability analysis, Mozilla's security team confirmed the sandbox escape and deemed the vulnerability to be tied to a Windows security flaw (what came to be CVE-2024-49039). This was a two-bug chain exploit that required no user interaction. ESET provides root cause analyses for both vulnerabilities, and provides Indicators of Compromise (IoC), and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK. See related Bleeping Computer reporting.

References:

  • CVE-2024-9680 (9.8 critical, disclosed 09 October 2024 by Firefox as an exploited zero-day) Use-after-free in Animation timeline (affects both Firefox and Thunderbird)
  • CVE-2024-49039 (8.8 high, disclosed 12 November 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day) Windows Task Scheduler Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

#romcom #russia #cyberespionage #firefox #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #microsoft #CVE_2024_9680 #CVE_2024_49039 #taskscheduler #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #mitreattack #ioc

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-26T11:10:04.000Z ##

RomCom hackers chained Firefox and Windows zero-days to deliver backdoor https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/11/26/romcom-backdoor-cve-2024-9680-cve-2024-49039/ #RussianFederation #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #backdoor #exploit #Firefox #Windows #0-day #News #ESET #APT

##
zeljkazorz at 2024-11-26T10:20:58.612Z ##

Russia-aligned APT group RomCom was behind attacks that leveraged two zero-days earlier this year: CVE-2024-9680, a remote code execution flaw in Firefox, and CVE-2024-49039, an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Task Scheduler.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/11/26/romcom-backdoor-cve-2024-9680-cve-2024-49039/

@ESETresearch #ZeroDay #Cybersecurity #APT

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:12:39.000Z ##

ESET Research RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild
ESET provides background information behind the Mozilla products zero-day CVE-2024-9680, stating that it was exploited in the wild by Russia-aligned group RomCom (aka Storm-0978, Tropical Scorpius, or UNC2596) since at least 08 October 2024. During the vulnerability analysis, Mozilla's security team confirmed the sandbox escape and deemed the vulnerability to be tied to a Windows security flaw (what came to be CVE-2024-49039). This was a two-bug chain exploit that required no user interaction. ESET provides root cause analyses for both vulnerabilities, and provides Indicators of Compromise (IoC), and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK. See related Bleeping Computer reporting.

References:

  • CVE-2024-9680 (9.8 critical, disclosed 09 October 2024 by Firefox as an exploited zero-day) Use-after-free in Animation timeline (affects both Firefox and Thunderbird)
  • CVE-2024-49039 (8.8 high, disclosed 12 November 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day) Windows Task Scheduler Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-8237
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-26T19:15:32.033000

2 posts

A Denial of Service (DoS) issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions prior to 12.6 prior to 17.4.5, 17.5 prior to 17.5.3, and 17.6 prior to 17.6.1. An attacker could cause a denial of service with a crafted cargo.toml file.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:33:23.198Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.1, 17.5.3, 17.4.5

  • CVE-2024-8114 (8.2 high) Privilege Escalation via LFS Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8237 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) through uncontrolled resource consumption when viewing a maliciously crafted cargo.toml file.
  • CVE-2024-11669 (6.5 medium) Unintended Access to Usage Data via Scoped Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8177 (5.3 medium) Gitlab DOS via Harbor registry integration
  • CVE-2024-1947 (4.3 medium) Resource exhaustion and denial of service with test_report API calls
  • CVE-2024-11668 (4.2 medium) Streaming endpoint did not invalidate tokens after revocation

No mention of exploitation.

#gitlab #vulnerability #cve #patchtuesday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:33:23.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.1, 17.5.3, 17.4.5

  • CVE-2024-8114 (8.2 high) Privilege Escalation via LFS Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8237 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) through uncontrolled resource consumption when viewing a maliciously crafted cargo.toml file.
  • CVE-2024-11669 (6.5 medium) Unintended Access to Usage Data via Scoped Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8177 (5.3 medium) Gitlab DOS via Harbor registry integration
  • CVE-2024-1947 (4.3 medium) Resource exhaustion and denial of service with test_report API calls
  • CVE-2024-11668 (4.2 medium) Streaming endpoint did not invalidate tokens after revocation

No mention of exploitation.

#gitlab #vulnerability #cve #patchtuesday

CVE-2024-8177
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-26T19:15:31.860000

2 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 15.6 prior to 17.4.5, starting from 17.5 prior to 17.5.3, starting from 17.6 prior to 17.6.1 which could cause Denial of Service via integrating a malicious harbor registry.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:33:23.198Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.1, 17.5.3, 17.4.5

  • CVE-2024-8114 (8.2 high) Privilege Escalation via LFS Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8237 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) through uncontrolled resource consumption when viewing a maliciously crafted cargo.toml file.
  • CVE-2024-11669 (6.5 medium) Unintended Access to Usage Data via Scoped Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8177 (5.3 medium) Gitlab DOS via Harbor registry integration
  • CVE-2024-1947 (4.3 medium) Resource exhaustion and denial of service with test_report API calls
  • CVE-2024-11668 (4.2 medium) Streaming endpoint did not invalidate tokens after revocation

No mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-8114
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-26T19:15:31.660000

2 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 8.12 before 17.4.5, 17.5 before 17.5.3, and 17.6 before 17.6.1. This issue allows an attacker with access to a victim's Personal Access Token (PAT) to escalate privileges.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:33:23.198Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.1, 17.5.3, 17.4.5

  • CVE-2024-8114 (8.2 high) Privilege Escalation via LFS Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8237 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) through uncontrolled resource consumption when viewing a maliciously crafted cargo.toml file.
  • CVE-2024-11669 (6.5 medium) Unintended Access to Usage Data via Scoped Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8177 (5.3 medium) Gitlab DOS via Harbor registry integration
  • CVE-2024-1947 (4.3 medium) Resource exhaustion and denial of service with test_report API calls
  • CVE-2024-11668 (4.2 medium) Streaming endpoint did not invalidate tokens after revocation

No mention of exploitation.

#gitlab #vulnerability #cve #patchtuesday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:33:23.000Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.1, 17.5.3, 17.4.5

  • CVE-2024-8114 (8.2 high) Privilege Escalation via LFS Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8237 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) through uncontrolled resource consumption when viewing a maliciously crafted cargo.toml file.
  • CVE-2024-11669 (6.5 medium) Unintended Access to Usage Data via Scoped Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8177 (5.3 medium) Gitlab DOS via Harbor registry integration
  • CVE-2024-1947 (4.3 medium) Resource exhaustion and denial of service with test_report API calls
  • CVE-2024-11668 (4.2 medium) Streaming endpoint did not invalidate tokens after revocation

No mention of exploitation.

updated 2024-11-26T15:15:31.957000

VMware Aria Operations contains a local privilege escalation vulnerability.  A malicious actor with local administrative privileges can insert malicious commands into the properties file to escalate privileges to  a root user on the appliance running VMware Aria Operations.

This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to install and activate arbitrary plugins which can be leveraged to achieve remote

##

CVE-2023-28461
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.32%

updated 2024-11-25T18:33:22

12 posts

Array Networks Array AG Series and vxAG (9.4.0.481 and earlier) allow remote code execution. An attacker can browse the filesystem on the SSL VPN gateway using a flags attribute in an HTTP header without authentication. The product could then be exploited through a vulnerable URL. The 2023-03-09 vendor advisory stated "a new Array AG release with the fix will be available soon."

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T14:59:43.156Z ##

Just a note that CVE-2023-28461 (9.8 critical) Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability, added 25 November 2024 to the KEV Catalog, is known to be used in ransomware campaigns, according to CISA.

EDIT: NEW! Fancy red triangle 🔺when known to be used in ransomware campaigns.

EDIT2: Known to be exploited by the Chinese state actor "Earth Kasha" which may be related to APT10. https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/k/lodeinfo-campaign-of-earth-kasha.html

#CVE_2023_28461 #arraynetworks #ransomware #threatintel #vulnerability #infosec #cve #eitw #activeexploitation #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #kev #cisa

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-25T15:59:34.319Z ##

Hot off the press! CVE-2023-28461 (9.8 critical) Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability

#CVE_2023_28461 #arraynetworks #arrayos #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-02T14:59:43.000Z ##

Just a note that CVE-2023-28461 (9.8 critical) Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability, added 25 November 2024 to the KEV Catalog, is known to be used in ransomware campaigns, according to CISA.

EDIT: NEW! Fancy red triangle 🔺when known to be used in ransomware campaigns.

EDIT2: Known to be exploited by the Chinese state actor "Earth Kasha" which may be related to APT10. https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/k/lodeinfo-campaign-of-earth-kasha.html

#CVE_2023_28461 #arraynetworks #ransomware #threatintel #vulnerability #infosec #cve #eitw #activeexploitation #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #kev #cisa

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T15:59:34.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CVE-2023-28461 (9.8 critical) Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability

#CVE_2023_28461 #arraynetworks #arrayos #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.488Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
jbhall56 at 2024-11-26T13:52:43.858Z ##

The security issue is tracked as CVE-2023-28461 and has been assigned a critical 9.8 severity score and the agency has included it to the catalog of Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV). https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hackers-exploit-critical-bug-in-array-networks-ssl-vpn-products/

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-26T12:15:02.000Z ##

CISA Adds Array Networks’ CVE-2023-28461 to KEV List: Critical Patching Urged https://thecyberexpress.com/cisa-adds-cve-2023-28461-vulnerability/ #TheCyberExpressNews #securityadvisory #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #SSLVPNgateway #CVE202328461 #CyberNews #CISA #KEV

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-11-25T16:00:45.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2023-28461
Vendor: Array Networks
Product: AG/vxAG ArrayOS
Date Added: 2024-11-25
Vulnerability: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication Vulnerability
Notes: https://support.arraynetworks.net/prx/001/http/supportportal.arraynetworks.net/documentation/FieldNotice/Array_Networks_Security_Advisory_for_Remote_Code_Execution_Vulnerability_AG.pdf ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28461
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28461

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.000Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T13:52:43.000Z ##

The security issue is tracked as CVE-2023-28461 and has been assigned a critical 9.8 severity score and the agency has included it to the catalog of Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV). https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/hackers-exploit-critical-bug-in-array-networks-ssl-vpn-products/

CVE-2024-53054
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-22T21:33:17

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: cgroup/bpf: use a dedicated workqueue for cgroup bpf destruction A hung_task problem shown below was found: INFO: task kworker/0:0:8 blocked for more than 327 seconds. "echo 0 > /proc/sys/kernel/hung_task_timeout_secs" disables this message. Workqueue: events cgroup_bpf_release Call Trace: <TASK> __schedule+0x5a2/0x2050 ? fi

1 repos

#search_error

adulau at 2024-11-29T09:21:26.019Z ##

Ever wondered what happens to rejected CVEs that still appear in other sources? Tools like vulnerability-lookup highlight these cases, underscoring the critical need to cross-correlate vulnerability data for accuracy and completeness.

cve-2024-53054 is a vulnerability in the Linux kernel documented but rejected as CVE.

#vulnerability #cve #cybersecurity #opensource #opendata #linuxkernel

🔗 https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/cve-2024-53054

##
adulau@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-29T09:21:26.000Z ##

cve-2024-53054 is a vulnerability in the Linux kernel documented but rejected as CVE.

CVE-2024-11477
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-22T21:32:24

12 posts

7-Zip Zstandard Decompression Integer Underflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of 7-Zip. Interaction with this library is required to exploit this vulnerability but attack vectors may vary depending on the implementation. The specific flaw exists within the implementation of Zstandard decompressio

1 repos

https://github.com/TheN00bBuilder/cve-2024-11477-writeup

ManzanasEnfrentadas@mas.to at 2024-11-28T11:02:22.000Z ##

🚨 🚨 🚨Actualización Importante:

Grave vulnerabilidad en 7-Zip (CVE-2024-11477): permite ejecución de código malicioso mediante archivos diseñados.

⚠️ Puntuación CVSS: 7.8.

🔒 Actualiza YA a la versión 24.07 o superior para proteger tu sistema.

##
appinn@pullopen.xyz at 2024-11-28T10:17:03.000Z ##

『7-Zip 爆高危漏洞，可远程执行代码，尽快更新至 24.08 版本』
著名的开源压缩/解压缩工具 7-ZIP 爆出一个高危漏洞 CVE-2024-11477，存在于 7-Zip 的 Zstandard 解压缩功能中，它允许攻击者在用户打开恶意压缩包时执行远程代码。该漏洞
……
阅读全文： :sys_link: https://www.appinn.com/7-zip-cve-2024-11477/

##
fredbrooker@witter.cz at 2024-11-25T21:03:43.000Z ##

A severe security vulnerability has been discovered in 7-Zip, the popular file compression utility, allowing remote attackers to execute malicious code through specially crafted archives.

The vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-11477 has received a high CVSS score of 7.8, indicating significant security risks for users of affected versions.

this is bad ...

#security #7zip

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-25T14:05:27.404Z ##

@hrbrmstr CVE-2024-11477 (7.8 high, disclosed 20 November 2024 by Zero Day Initiative) improper input validation results in integer underflow, which can result in remote code execution in 7-Zip. It is fixed in 7-Zip 24.07 (6/19 was 5 months ago) but their changelog doesn't identify the security vulnerability or its severity.

##
hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-11-25T14:02:55.000Z ##

CVESky (https://cvesky.labs.greynoise.io/) snagged CVE-2024-11477 today.

On the surface (I did no rev.eng.) this seems like it's gonna take alot of orgs (that allow ZIP uploads and then expands them) by surprise if it ends up being easily or even moderately exploitable. Check your SBOMs!

##
decio at 2024-11-25T09:37:44.019Z ##

⚠️ Vulnérabilité dans 7-Zip : mise à jour nécessaire
⬇️
Une faille permet aux attaquants d’injecter du code malveillant via des archives manipulées (CVE-2024-11477, risque élevé). Téléchargez et installez la version 24.08 sur le site officiel pour vous protéger.
👇
https://www.7-zip.org/

ℹ️ Pas de mise à jour automatique : action manuelle requise

"7-Zip flaw enables code smuggling with manipulated archives
Attackers can use manipulated archives to try to inject malicious code into 7-Zip users. An update is available."
👇
https://www.heise.de/en/news/7-Zip-flaw-enables-code-smuggling-with-manipulated-archives-10083922.html

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_11477 #7zip #vulnerabilite

##

CVE-2024-44309
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.18%

updated 2024-11-22T04:25:03

6 posts

A cookie management issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in Safari 18.1.1, iOS 17.7.2 and iPadOS 17.7.2, macOS Sequoia 15.1.1, iOS 18.1.1 and iPadOS 18.1.1, visionOS 2.1.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to a cross site scripting attack. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited on Intel-based Mac systems.

ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:48:18.000Z ##

Also for anyone else who wants to check this on their distro of choice. It turns out that you do not need to inspect the package contents as I did. @sesivany kindly pointed out that the page about://version lists this information directly (even though the about dialog from "[main] Menu → About Web" does not).

Here is a screenshot from the current Flatpak version, confirming it is linked against WebKitGTK 2.46.4, which should be safe against the recent zero day issues that the Apple and the WebKitGTK security pages mention (i.e. CVE-2024-44308 and CVE-2024-44309).

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:25:45.000Z ##

The copy of Gnome Web provided by Ubuntu 24.04 is 46.0 and this is linked against libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.5, which is part of libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 version 2.46.3-0ubuntu0.24.04.1, a.k.a. WebKitGTK 2.46.3, which according to https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html is NOT protected against CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309

"Versions affected: WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

Put another way, don't use the deb version of Gnome Web that Ubuntu 24.04 provides (as I write this). It has known exploits in the wild. 😱

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:06:25.000Z ##

Understanding if Gnome Web (Epiphany) is up to date and secure is kind of a pain in the ass. The most up to date package available to me seems to be the Flathub package which is on version 47.2.

However, since the engine is WebKitGTK, its security page https://webkitgtk.org/security.html is just as (if not more) important. This page lists the most recent problems being annouced on November 27, 2024, specifically CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309. These are the same identifiers as the security issues that Apple announced on November 19, 2024 and those are zero day reports (known exploits in the wild), so I know they are serious shit https://support.apple.com/en-us/121752

But the WebKitGTK page does not say which versions of Gnome Web are affected. Rather it just says "WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html

But what version of WebKitGTK is my flatpak packaged 47.2 linked against? 🤷

In the end I started a shell into the flatpak package

```
flatpak run --command=bash org.gnome.Epiphany
```

and had a look around at the contents, eventually locating the file /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.6

Online seaching seems to suggest this file is associated with WebKitGTK version 2.46.4. So yeah, it should be patched against the zero day issues but that was a lot of work for me to be sure that it's secure.

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:48:18.000Z ##

Also for anyone else who wants to check this on their distro of choice. It turns out that you do not need to inspect the package contents as I did. @sesivany kindly pointed out that the page about://version lists this information directly (even though the about dialog from "[main] Menu → About Web" does not).

Here is a screenshot from the current Flatpak version, confirming it is linked against WebKitGTK 2.46.4, which should be safe against the recent zero day issues that the Apple and the WebKitGTK security pages mention (i.e. CVE-2024-44308 and CVE-2024-44309).

CVE-2024-38475
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-21T09:26:03.180000

2 posts

Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure. Substitutions in server context that use a backreferences or variables as the first segment of the su

2 repos

https://github.com/p0in7s/CVE-2024-38475

https://github.com/mrmtwoj/apache-vulnerability-testing

screaminggoat at 2024-12-05T12:21:09.490Z ##

SonicWall security advisory 03 December 2024: SonicWall SMA100 SSL-VPN Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-38475 (7.5 high) Path traversal vulnerability – attributed to publicly known Apache HTTP Server vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-40763 (7.5 high) SonicWALL SMA100 Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45318 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45319 (6.3 medium) Certificate-based authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-53702 (5.3 medium) Insecure randomness 🤪
  • CVE-2024-53703 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild

#sonicwall #sma #sslvpn #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-05T12:21:09.000Z ##

SonicWall security advisory 03 December 2024: SonicWall SMA100 SSL-VPN Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-38475 (7.5 high) Path traversal vulnerability – attributed to publicly known Apache HTTP Server vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-40763 (7.5 high) SonicWALL SMA100 Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45318 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45319 (6.3 medium) Certificate-based authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-53702 (5.3 medium) Insecure randomness 🤪
  • CVE-2024-53703 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild

(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-21T08:50:07.567000

2 posts

The Exclusive Addons for Elementor plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via data attribute in all versions up to, and including, 2.6.9 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor access or higher, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an in

1 repos

https://github.com/RoyaRadin/CVE-2024-12345-POC

JeremiahFieldhaven@mastodon.gamedev.place at 2024-11-27T10:59:46.000Z ##

Looking at the release for a large piece of software this morning, I'm reminded that my brain doesn't work like some security people's.

It's not *quite* "CVE-2024-1234: if an attacker has obtained a user's username, password, date of birth, first pet's name, street they grew up on, and mother's maiden name, they can in rare circumstances perform this very difficult and dubiously physically-possible set of actions to edit their profile picture. This is a critical vulnerability!"

CVE-2024-0014
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-21T08:45:42.070000

2 posts

In startInstall of UpdateFetcher.java, there is a possible way to trigger a malicious config update due to a logic error. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

badsamurai at 2024-11-27T02:06:06.531Z ##

Vuln nerds, CVE-2024-0012 seems like it sat for a while. CVE-2024-0014 was a Java thing disclosed quickly with a public notice on 2024-02-01. So how long ago would you guess 0012 was filed?

#vulnerability #paloaltonetworks

CVE-2023-6548
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.62%

updated 2024-11-21T08:44:04.570000

1 posts

Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection') in NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway allows an attacker with access to NSIP, CLIP or SNIP with management interface to perform Authenticated (low privileged) remote code execution on Management Interface.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T01:40:09.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @h4sh @todb From start of the year until now, a lot of software vendors have tried their darnedest to keep the zero-day exploitation under wraps until they released patches:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti with CVE-2023-46805 (NO PATCHES) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Google Chrome with CVE-2024-0519 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

...I FORGOT HOW CRAZY JANUARY WAS

I'd type more but the ones that stand out were Ivanti, Palo Alto Networks (CVE-2024-3400) and Cisco (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) for confirming unpatched exploited zero-days.

CVE-2023-40238
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-21T08:19:02.947000

2 posts

A LogoFAIL issue was discovered in BmpDecoderDxe in Insyde InsydeH2O with kernel 5.2 before 05.28.47, 5.3 before 05.37.47, 5.4 before 05.45.47, 5.5 before 05.53.47, and 5.6 before 05.60.47 for certain Lenovo devices. Image parsing of crafted BMP logo files can copy data to a specific address during the DXE phase of UEFI execution. This occurs because of an integer signedness error involving PixelH

CVE-2023-20269
(5.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 4.02%

updated 2024-11-21T07:41:02.433000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the remote access VPN feature of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a brute force attack in an attempt to identify valid username and password combinations or an authenticated, remote attacker to establish a clientless SSL VPN session with an unauthorized us

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T14:51:08.771Z ##

Unit 42: Threat Assessment: Howling Scorpius (Akira Ransomware)
Not to be outdone by Check Point Research, Unit 42 provides a whole ransomware actor profile for Akira Ransomware. Akira is a Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) group relying on a double extortion strategy. They operate a Tor-based data leak site for listing victims and exfiltrating stolen data. Unit 42 describes targeted regions and industries, and provides a technical analysis of Akira's attack lifecycle. Vulnerabilities they exploit include CVE-2020-3259 (7.5 high) Cisco ASA and FTD Information Disclosure Vulnerability and CVE-2023-20269 (5.0 medium) Cisco ASA and FTD Unauthorized Access Vulnerability. Indicators of compromise include Check Point Research's single SHA256 hash, listed as Akira_v2.

#akira #ransomware #HowlingScorpius #cybercrime #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-03T14:51:08.000Z ##

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:14:48.322Z ##

Aqua Security: Matrix Unleashes A New Widespread DDoS Campaign
A threat actor named Matrix (who AquaSec believes to be an amateur or script kiddie) is conducting a new and widespread Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) campaign. Aqua assesses that Matrix is financially motivated despite "strong signs of Russian affiliation (or at least crafting that perception)" due to the absence of Ukrainian targeting. The threat actor is actively targeting both development and production servers. Aqua describes Matrix's exploitation of vulnerabilities and misconfigurations, potential targeting list, GitHub repository of botnet and tools, and advertising of DDoS services. Indicators of compromise listed, and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

Note: CVE-2022-30075, CVE-2018-9995, CVE-2017-17215, CVE-2017-17106 are not in the KEV Catalog yet.

#matrix #ddos #ddosaas #scriptkiddie #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #mitreattack #ioc #vulnerability #eitw #iot #botnet #activeexploitation #mirai

##

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T16:05:20.983Z ##

Fortinet: SmokeLoader Attack Targets Companies in Taiwan
Fortinet reports on a September 2024 campaign targeting Taiwanese companies with SmokeLoader malware. Victims were in manufacturing, healthcare, information technology, and other sectors. The infection chain leverages both CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office and WordPad Remote Code Execution Vulnerability and CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Indicators of compromise provided.

#smokeloader #taiwan #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_1182 #vulnerability #eitw #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #CyberThreatIntelligence #CTI

##

CVE-2024-44308
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.18%

updated 2024-11-20T18:33:20

7 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in Safari 18.1.1, iOS 17.7.2 and iPadOS 17.7.2, macOS Sequoia 15.1.1, iOS 18.1.1 and iPadOS 18.1.1, visionOS 2.1.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited on Intel-based Mac systems.

threatcodex at 2024-12-04T11:22:57.440Z ##

[In-The-Wild] CVE-2024-44308 : Apple Safari JavaScriptCore Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
#CVE_2024_44308
http://threat-intelligence.llm.re.kr/2024-12-01/CVE-2024-44308

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:48:18.000Z ##

Also for anyone else who wants to check this on their distro of choice. It turns out that you do not need to inspect the package contents as I did. @sesivany kindly pointed out that the page about://version lists this information directly (even though the about dialog from "[main] Menu → About Web" does not).

Here is a screenshot from the current Flatpak version, confirming it is linked against WebKitGTK 2.46.4, which should be safe against the recent zero day issues that the Apple and the WebKitGTK security pages mention (i.e. CVE-2024-44308 and CVE-2024-44309).

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:25:45.000Z ##

The copy of Gnome Web provided by Ubuntu 24.04 is 46.0 and this is linked against libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.5, which is part of libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 version 2.46.3-0ubuntu0.24.04.1, a.k.a. WebKitGTK 2.46.3, which according to https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html is NOT protected against CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309

"Versions affected: WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

Put another way, don't use the deb version of Gnome Web that Ubuntu 24.04 provides (as I write this). It has known exploits in the wild. 😱

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:06:25.000Z ##

Understanding if Gnome Web (Epiphany) is up to date and secure is kind of a pain in the ass. The most up to date package available to me seems to be the Flathub package which is on version 47.2.

However, since the engine is WebKitGTK, its security page https://webkitgtk.org/security.html is just as (if not more) important. This page lists the most recent problems being annouced on November 27, 2024, specifically CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309. These are the same identifiers as the security issues that Apple announced on November 19, 2024 and those are zero day reports (known exploits in the wild), so I know they are serious shit https://support.apple.com/en-us/121752

But the WebKitGTK page does not say which versions of Gnome Web are affected. Rather it just says "WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html

But what version of WebKitGTK is my flatpak packaged 47.2 linked against? 🤷

In the end I started a shell into the flatpak package

```
flatpak run --command=bash org.gnome.Epiphany
```

and had a look around at the contents, eventually locating the file /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.6

Online seaching seems to suggest this file is associated with WebKitGTK version 2.46.4. So yeah, it should be patched against the zero day issues but that was a lot of work for me to be sure that it's secure.

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:48:18.000Z ##

Also for anyone else who wants to check this on their distro of choice. It turns out that you do not need to inspect the package contents as I did. @sesivany kindly pointed out that the page about://version lists this information directly (even though the about dialog from "[main] Menu → About Web" does not).

Here is a screenshot from the current Flatpak version, confirming it is linked against WebKitGTK 2.46.4, which should be safe against the recent zero day issues that the Apple and the WebKitGTK security pages mention (i.e. CVE-2024-44308 and CVE-2024-44309).

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:25:45.000Z ##

The copy of Gnome Web provided by Ubuntu 24.04 is 46.0 and this is linked against libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.5, which is part of libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 version 2.46.3-0ubuntu0.24.04.1, a.k.a. WebKitGTK 2.46.3, which according to https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html is NOT protected against CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309

"Versions affected: WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

Put another way, don't use the deb version of Gnome Web that Ubuntu 24.04 provides (as I write this). It has known exploits in the wild. 😱

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:06:25.000Z ##

Understanding if Gnome Web (Epiphany) is up to date and secure is kind of a pain in the ass. The most up to date package available to me seems to be the Flathub package which is on version 47.2.

However, since the engine is WebKitGTK, its security page https://webkitgtk.org/security.html is just as (if not more) important. This page lists the most recent problems being annouced on November 27, 2024, specifically CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309. These are the same identifiers as the security issues that Apple announced on November 19, 2024 and those are zero day reports (known exploits in the wild), so I know they are serious shit https://support.apple.com/en-us/121752

But the WebKitGTK page does not say which versions of Gnome Web are affected. Rather it just says "WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html

But what version of WebKitGTK is my flatpak packaged 47.2 linked against? 🤷

In the end I started a shell into the flatpak package

```
flatpak run --command=bash org.gnome.Epiphany
```

and had a look around at the contents, eventually locating the file /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.6

Online seaching seems to suggest this file is associated with WebKitGTK version 2.46.4. So yeah, it should be patched against the zero day issues but that was a lot of work for me to be sure that it's secure.

##

CVE-2024-52430
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-11-20T15:27:58.350000

1 posts

Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability in Lis Lis Video Gallery allows Object Injection.This issue affects Lis Video Gallery: from n/a through 0.2.1.

1 repos

https://github.com/RandomRobbieBF/CVE-2024-52430

CVE-2024-8001
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-19T15:41:25.973000

2 posts

A vulnerability was found in VIWIS LMS 9.11. It has been classified as critical. Affected is an unknown function of the component Print Handler. The manipulation leads to missing authorization. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. A user with the role learner can use the administrative print function with an active session before and after an exam slot to access the entire exam including

CVE-2024-8068(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-14T18:30:34

2 posts

Privilege escalation to NetworkService Account access in Citrix Session Recording when an attacker is an authenticated user in the same Windows Active Directory domain as the session recording server domain

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T17:54:57.881Z ##

Be on the lookout: Exploitation reports for both Citrix Session Recording vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-8068 (CVSSv4: 5.1 medium) Privilege escalation to NetworkService Account access
  • CVE-2024-8069 (CVSSv4: 5.1 medium/CISA-ADP: CVSSv3: 8.8 high) Limited remote code execution with privilege of a NetworkService Account access

First announced 15 November 2024. Proofs of concept were available from watchTowr. Report is unconfirmed but source is a trusted partner. No indicators or additional information available.

#threatintel #citrix #virtualappsanddesktops #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_8068 #CVE_2024_8069 #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

  • CVE-2024-8068 (CVSSv4: 5.1 medium) Privilege escalation to NetworkService Account access
  • CVE-2024-8069 (CVSSv4: 5.1 medium/CISA-ADP: CVSSv3: 8.8 high) Limited remote code execution with privilege of a NetworkService Account access

First announced 15 November 2024. Proofs of concept were available from watchTowr. Report is unconfirmed but source is a trusted partner. No indicators or additional information available.

CVE-2024-2550(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-14T12:31:01

9 posts

A null pointer dereference vulnerability in the GlobalProtect gateway in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an unauthenticated attacker to stop the GlobalProtect service on the firewall by sending a specially crafted packet that causes a denial of service (DoS) condition. Repeated attempts to trigger this condition result in the firewall entering maintenance mode.

CVE-2014-2120
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.25%

updated 2024-11-13T18:31:52

4 posts

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the WebVPN login page in Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via an unspecified parameter, aka Bug ID CSCun19025.

1 repos

#search_error

AAKL at 2024-12-03T14:55:36.978Z ##

This was posted yesterday, if you missed it.

Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance WebVPN Login Page Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-CVE-2014-2120 @TalosSecurity

More: #Cisco Warns of Exploitation of Decade-Old ASA WebVPN Vulnerability https://thehackernews.com/2024/12/cisco-warns-of-exploitation-of-decade.html @thehackernews #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T20:23:05.151Z ##

Cisco updated a security advisory from 2014: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance WebVPN Login Page Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

In November 2024, the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) became aware of additional attempted exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild. Cisco continues to strongly recommend that customers upgrade to a fixed software release to remediate this vulnerability.

CVE-2014-2120 (CVSSv2: 4.3 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability was already added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 12 November 2024, with the vendor likely the source of the exploitation evidence.

#cisco #CiscoASA #CVE_2024_2120 #cybersecurity #infosec #vulnerability #eitw #cve #activeexploitation

##

Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance WebVPN Login Page Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-CVE-2014-2120 @TalosSecurity

More: #Cisco Warns of Exploitation of Decade-Old ASA WebVPN Vulnerability https://thehackernews.com/2024/12/cisco-warns-of-exploitation-of-decade.html @thehackernews #cybersecurity #infosec

CVE-2024-8069
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-13T17:01:16.850000

4 posts

Limited remote code execution with privilege of a NetworkService Account access in Citrix Session Recording if the attacker is an authenticated user on the same intranet as the session recording server

1 repos

https://github.com/XiaomingX/cve-2024-8069-exp-Citrix-Virtual-Apps-XEN

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T17:54:57.881Z ##

Be on the lookout: Exploitation reports for both Citrix Session Recording vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-8068 (CVSSv4: 5.1 medium) Privilege escalation to NetworkService Account access
  • CVE-2024-8069 (CVSSv4: 5.1 medium/CISA-ADP: CVSSv3: 8.8 high) Limited remote code execution with privilege of a NetworkService Account access

First announced 15 November 2024. Proofs of concept were available from watchTowr. Report is unconfirmed but source is a trusted partner. No indicators or additional information available.

(8.4 HIGH)

updated 2024-11-12T21:30:51

2 posts

GNOME libsoup before 3.6.1 allows a buffer overflow in applications that perform conversion to UTF-8 in soup_header_parse_param_list_strict. Input received over the network cannot trigger this.

ただ、その時点ではどの脅威アクターがどんな標的を狙った攻撃 ... インテリジェンス要件定義に関するガイドブック：『要件主導型インテリジェンスプログラムの ...
https://codebook.machinarecord.com/threatreport/36001/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:12:39.164Z ##

ESET Research RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild
ESET provides background information behind the Mozilla products zero-day CVE-2024-9680, stating that it was exploited in the wild by Russia-aligned group RomCom (aka Storm-0978, Tropical Scorpius, or UNC2596) since at least 08 October 2024. During the vulnerability analysis, Mozilla's security team confirmed the sandbox escape and deemed the vulnerability to be tied to a Windows security flaw (what came to be CVE-2024-49039). This was a two-bug chain exploit that required no user interaction. ESET provides root cause analyses for both vulnerabilities, and provides Indicators of Compromise (IoC), and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK. See related Bleeping Computer reporting.

References:

  • CVE-2024-9680 (9.8 critical, disclosed 09 October 2024 by Firefox as an exploited zero-day) Use-after-free in Animation timeline (affects both Firefox and Thunderbird)
  • CVE-2024-49039 (8.8 high, disclosed 12 November 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day) Windows Task Scheduler Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

#romcom #russia #cyberespionage #firefox #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #microsoft #CVE_2024_9680 #CVE_2024_49039 #taskscheduler #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #mitreattack #ioc

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-26T11:10:04.000Z ##

RomCom hackers chained Firefox and Windows zero-days to deliver backdoor https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/11/26/romcom-backdoor-cve-2024-9680-cve-2024-49039/ #RussianFederation #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #backdoor #exploit #Firefox #Windows #0-day #News #ESET #APT

##
zeljkazorz at 2024-11-26T10:20:58.612Z ##

Russia-aligned APT group RomCom was behind attacks that leveraged two zero-days earlier this year: CVE-2024-9680, a remote code execution flaw in Firefox, and CVE-2024-49039, an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Task Scheduler.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/11/26/romcom-backdoor-cve-2024-9680-cve-2024-49039/

@ESETresearch #ZeroDay #Cybersecurity #APT

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:12:39.000Z ##

ESET Research RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild
ESET provides background information behind the Mozilla products zero-day CVE-2024-9680, stating that it was exploited in the wild by Russia-aligned group RomCom (aka Storm-0978, Tropical Scorpius, or UNC2596) since at least 08 October 2024. During the vulnerability analysis, Mozilla's security team confirmed the sandbox escape and deemed the vulnerability to be tied to a Windows security flaw (what came to be CVE-2024-49039). This was a two-bug chain exploit that required no user interaction. ESET provides root cause analyses for both vulnerabilities, and provides Indicators of Compromise (IoC), and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK. See related Bleeping Computer reporting.

References:

  • CVE-2024-9680 (9.8 critical, disclosed 09 October 2024 by Firefox as an exploited zero-day) Use-after-free in Animation timeline (affects both Firefox and Thunderbird)
  • CVE-2024-49039 (8.8 high, disclosed 12 November 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day) Windows Task Scheduler Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

CVE-2024-47685
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-11-08T16:15:25.083000

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: netfilter: nf_reject_ipv6: fix nf_reject_ip6_tcphdr_put() syzbot reported that nf_reject_ip6_tcphdr_put() was possibly sending garbage on the four reserved tcp bits (th->res1) Use skb_put_zero() to clear the whole TCP header, as done in nf_reject_ip_tcphdr_put() BUG: KMSAN: uninit-value in nf_reject_ip6_tcphdr_put+0x688/0x6c0

(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-10-22T18:33:19

10 posts

A vulnerability in the NuPoint Unified Messaging (NPM) component of Mitel MiCollab through 9.8 SP1 FP2 (9.8.1.201) could allow an unauthenticated attacker to conduct a path traversal attack, due to insufficient input validation. A successful exploit could allow unauthorized access, enabling the attacker to view, corrupt, or delete users' data and system configurations.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-05T16:34:16.704Z ##

watchTowr: Where There's Smoke, There's Fire - Mitel MiCollab CVE-2024-35286, CVE-2024-41713 And An 0day
Mitel MiCollab is an application for voice, video, messaging, presence, audio conferencing, mobility and team collaboration. watchTowr publishes vulnerability details for CVE-2024-35286 (SQL Injection), and CVE-2024-41713 (authentication bypass). Additionally they publicly disclose a post-authenticated arbitrary file read vulnerability (unpatched) that Mitel failed to patch within 100 days of reporting. This includes proof of concept.

#mitel #micollab #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #proofofconcept #poc #voip

CVE-2024-1947
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-10-03T09:31:41

2 posts

A denial of service (DoS) condition was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 13.2.4 before 16.10.6, 16.11 before 16.11.3, and 17.0 before 17.0.1. By leveraging this vulnerability an attacker could create a DoS condition by sending crafted API calls.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:33:23.198Z ##

GitLab security advisory: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.1, 17.5.3, 17.4.5

  • CVE-2024-8114 (8.2 high) Privilege Escalation via LFS Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8237 (6.5 medium) Denial of Service (DoS) through uncontrolled resource consumption when viewing a maliciously crafted cargo.toml file.
  • CVE-2024-11669 (6.5 medium) Unintended Access to Usage Data via Scoped Tokens
  • CVE-2024-8177 (5.3 medium) Gitlab DOS via Harbor registry integration
  • CVE-2024-1947 (4.3 medium) Resource exhaustion and denial of service with test_report API calls
  • CVE-2024-11668 (4.2 medium) Streaming endpoint did not invalidate tokens after revocation

No mention of exploitation.

#gitlab #vulnerability #cve #patchtuesday

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: exec: Fix ToCToU between perm check and set-uid/gid usage When opening a file for exec via do_filp_open(), permission checking is done against the file's metadata at that moment, and on success, a file pointer is passed back. Much later in the execve() code path, the file metadata (specifically mode, uid, and gid) is used to det

Esta vulnerabilidad podría permitir a un atacante escalar privilegios en el sistema, lo que representa un riesgo moderado para la seguridad de los sistemas afectados.

CVE-2024-42057
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-03T03:30:40

6 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the IPSec VPN feature of Zyxel ATP series firmware versions from V4.32 through V5.38, USG FLEX series firmware versions from V4.50 through V5.38, USG FLEX 50(W) series firmware versions from V4.16 through V5.38, and USG20(W)-VPN series firmware versions from V4.16 through V5.38 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute some OS commands on an affected d

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-11-28T16:03:50.637Z ##

CERT Bund (Germany): Zyxel Firewalls zur Verbreitung von Ransomware missbraucht (PDF)
English translation of title: "Zyxel firewalls abused to spread ransomware" The Computer Emergency Response Team for Germany's federal authorities issued a security advisory warning that corporate networks were being infected with Helldown ransomware, and that exfiltrated information was threatened with release (double extortion). CERT-Bund explicitly states that "During the analysis, IT security researchers found that in most cases, a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls was probably exploited to carry out the attacks. However, it is still unclear what the vulnerability is in detail, and whether it is even publicly known."

Bei der Analyse fanden IT-Sicherheitsforschende heraus, dass zur Durchführung der Angriffe in den meisten Fällen vermutlich eine Schwachstelle in Zyxel Firewalls ausgenutzt wurde. Bislang ist jedoch unklar, um welche Schwachstelle es sich im Detail handelt und ob diese überhaupt öffentlich bekannt ist

CERT-Bund does not include any CVE IDs. While Sekoia and Cyfirma both allude to CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability (see parent toots above this), Zyxel's own security advisory mentions CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) a directory traversal vulnerability. cc: @todb @cR0w

View the vendor's security advisory: Zyxel security advisory: protecting against recent firewall threats

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_42057 #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-27T03:45:39.305Z ##

Cyfirma: Investigation into Helldown : RANSOMWARE
Cyfirma provides a lightweight analysis of Helldown ransomware, both Windows and Linux. They also believe that CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability plays a role in initial access. Cyfirma includes a Sigma rule and hashes for the ransomware.

See the Sekoia article in the parent toot above for more details.

#ransomware #helldown #CVE_2024_42057 #zyxel #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #Sigma

##
jbhall56 at 2024-11-26T13:24:40.085Z ##

The bug, tracked as CVE-2024-42057, could allow remote attackers to execute OS commands on vulnerable devices, without authentication. https://www.securityweek.com/recent-zyxel-firewall-vulnerability-exploited-in-ransomware-attacks/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-28T16:03:50.000Z ##

CERT Bund (Germany): Zyxel Firewalls zur Verbreitung von Ransomware missbraucht (PDF)
English translation of title: "Zyxel firewalls abused to spread ransomware" The Computer Emergency Response Team for Germany's federal authorities issued a security advisory warning that corporate networks were being infected with Helldown ransomware, and that exfiltrated information was threatened with release (double extortion). CERT-Bund explicitly states that "During the analysis, IT security researchers found that in most cases, a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls was probably exploited to carry out the attacks. However, it is still unclear what the vulnerability is in detail, and whether it is even publicly known."

Bei der Analyse fanden IT-Sicherheitsforschende heraus, dass zur Durchführung der Angriffe in den meisten Fällen vermutlich eine Schwachstelle in Zyxel Firewalls ausgenutzt wurde. Bislang ist jedoch unklar, um welche Schwachstelle es sich im Detail handelt und ob diese überhaupt öffentlich bekannt ist

CERT-Bund does not include any CVE IDs. While Sekoia and Cyfirma both allude to CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability (see parent toots above this), Zyxel's own security advisory mentions CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) a directory traversal vulnerability. cc: @todb @cR0w

View the vendor's security advisory: Zyxel security advisory: protecting against recent firewall threats

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_42057 #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-27T03:45:39.000Z ##

Cyfirma: Investigation into Helldown : RANSOMWARE
Cyfirma provides a lightweight analysis of Helldown ransomware, both Windows and Linux. They also believe that CVE-2024-42057 (8.1 high, disclosed 03 September 2024) Zyxel firewall command injection vulnerability plays a role in initial access. Cyfirma includes a Sigma rule and hashes for the ransomware.

See the Sekoia article in the parent toot above for more details.

#ransomware #helldown #CVE_2024_42057 #zyxel #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #IOC #Sigma

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T13:24:40.000Z ##

The bug, tracked as CVE-2024-42057, could allow remote attackers to execute OS commands on vulnerable devices, without authentication. https://www.securityweek.com/recent-zyxel-firewall-vulnerability-exploited-in-ransomware-attacks/

##

CVE-2024-45237
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-26T21:30:33

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Fort before 1.6.3. A malicious RPKI repository that descends from a (trusted) Trust Anchor can serve (via rsync or RRDP) a resource certificate containing a Key Usage extension composed of more than two bytes of data. Fort writes this string into a 2-byte buffer without properly sanitizing its length, leading to a buffer overflow.

arXiv_csCR_bot@mastoxiv.page at 2024-11-26T06:53:44.000Z ##

Poster: From Fort to Foe: The Threat of RCE in RPKI

Oliver Jacobsen, Haya Schulmann, Niklas Vogel, Michael Waidner
https://arxiv.org/abs/2411.16518 https://arxiv.org/pdf/2411.16518 https://arxiv.org/html/2411.16518

arXiv:2411.16518v1 Announce Type: new
Abstract: In this work, we present a novel severe buffer-overflow vulnerability in the RPKI validator Fort, that allows an attacker to achieve Remote Code Execution (RCE) on the machine running the software. We discuss the unique impact of this RCE on networks that use RPKI, illustrating that RCE vulnerabilities are especially severe in the context of RPKI. The design of RPKI makes RCE easy to exploit on a large scale, allows compromise of RPKI validation integrity, and enables a powerful vector for additional attacks on other critical components of the network, like the border routers.
We analyze the vulnerability exposing to this RCE and identify indications that the discovered vulnerability could constitute an intentional backdoor to compromise systems running the software over a benign coding mistake. We disclosed the vulnerability, which has been assigned a CVE rated 9.8 critical (CVE-2024-45237).

##
arXiv_csCR_bot@mastoxiv.page at 2024-11-26T06:53:44.000Z ##

Poster: From Fort to Foe: The Threat of RCE in RPKI

Oliver Jacobsen, Haya Schulmann, Niklas Vogel, Michael Waidner
https://arxiv.org/abs/2411.16518 https://arxiv.org/pdf/2411.16518 https://arxiv.org/html/2411.16518

arXiv:2411.16518v1 Announce Type: new
Abstract: In this work, we present a novel severe buffer-overflow vulnerability in the RPKI validator Fort, that allows an attacker to achieve Remote Code Execution (RCE) on the machine running the software. We discuss the unique impact of this RCE on networks that use RPKI, illustrating that RCE vulnerabilities are especially severe in the context of RPKI. The design of RPKI makes RCE easy to exploit on a large scale, allows compromise of RPKI validation integrity, and enables a powerful vector for additional attacks on other critical components of the network, like the border routers.
We analyze the vulnerability exposing to this RCE and identify indications that the discovered vulnerability could constitute an intentional backdoor to compromise systems running the software over a benign coding mistake. We disclosed the vulnerability, which has been assigned a CVE rated 9.8 critical (CVE-2024-45237).

updated 2024-08-15T20:32:42.193000

Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

AAKL at 2024-12-02T18:42:50.599Z ##

Microsoft has an update on CVE-2024-38199:

Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38199 #cybersecurity #infosec #Windows #Microsoft

Also:

Google's Android Security Bulletin for December 2024 https://source.android.com/docs/security/bulletin/2024-12-01#Android-and-Google-service-mitigations #Android #Google

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T18:29:50.993Z ##

How likely would a Beijing-based cybersecurity company comply with the requirement to first report software vulnerabilities to the PRC Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT)? 🤔 After 4 months, Microsoft credited bee13oy with Cyber Kunlun Lab for CVE-2024-38199, (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024) Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This was marked publicly disclosed at the time of announcement.

Not disparaging their company, just curious as to the background of CVE-2024-38199 being publicly disclosed.

CVE-2024-38143

2 posts

1 repos

#search_error

itm4n at 2024-12-03T20:45:55.809Z ##

Interestingly enough, MS disabled the "Use my Windows user account" checkbox when connecting to Wi-Fi on the lock screen to address CVE-2024-38143 in the August Patch Tuesday.

This change completely remediates the "Airstrike" attack as well. 🤯

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/august-13-2024-kb5041585-os-builds-22621-4037-and-22631-4037-76655cde-e2ee-49d4-a415-cf9a4d3c3a04

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-24T19:19:06.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @todb @h4sh

One more example that I was able to find: https://infosec.exchange/@screaminggoat/112130101612487106 a vulnerability reporter reached out to the vendor who didn't respond, and after having issues communicating with MITRE, KoreLogic reached out to Austin Hackers Anonymous @AustinHackers to get a CVE assigned (CVE-2024-2054) for an unpatched Artica Proxy Unauthenticated PHP Deserialization Vulnerability.

EDIT: Timeline from contacting vendor to CVE assigned was 74 days, 78 includes public disclosure.

##

CVE-2024-29014
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-01T15:33:12

5 posts

Vulnerability in SonicWall NetExtender Windows (32 and 64-bit) client 10.2.339 and earlier versions allows an attacker to arbitrary code execution when processing an EPC Client update.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T19:10:43.669Z ##

@cR0w @hrbrmstr Judging by the SonicWall NetExtender vulnerability analysis, there are three vectors of achieving RCE:

  • An attacker could convince a user to connect their NetExtender client to a malicious VPN server. (UserInteraction:Required) They would then send a fake EPC Client update (malicious executable) signed with a valid (but potentially compromised or purchased) code-signing certificate. This is the vulnerability.
  • "When the SMA Connect Agent is installed, attackers can exploit a custom URI handler to force the NetExtender client to connect to their server. Users only need to visit a malicious website and accept a browser prompt, or open a malicious document for the attack to succeed." (UI:R)
  • A low-privileged user on the same machine can exploit this vulnerability to escalate their privileges to SYSTEM by connecting to a malicious server. (LPE?)
##
screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T17:48:36.872Z ##

AmberWolf: SonicWall NetExtender for Windows - RCE as SYSTEM via EPC Client Update (CVE-2024-29014)
Reference: CVE-2024-29014 (7.1 high, disclosed 17 July 2024 by SonicWall) SonicWall NetExtender for Windows remote code execution vulnerability

An attacker could convince a user to connect their NetExtender client to a malicious VPN server. The attacker can then deliver a fake EPC Client update signed with a valid (but potentially compromised or purchased) code-signing certificate. This results in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges.

cc: @cR0w this sounds like the Palo Alto Networks one 🤔 . They provide vulnerability details for CVE-2024-29014 and a proof of concept called NachoVPN, which is a tool that demonstrates exploitation of SSL-VPN clients using a rogue VPN server.

#sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_29014 #info #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-11-26T16:35:03.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T17:48:36.000Z ##

Reference: CVE-2024-29014 (7.1 high, disclosed 17 July 2024 by SonicWall) SonicWall NetExtender for Windows remote code execution vulnerability

An attacker could convince a user to connect their NetExtender client to a malicious VPN server. The attacker can then deliver a fake EPC Client update signed with a valid (but potentially compromised or purchased) code-signing certificate. This results in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges.

CVE-2024-0519
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2024-07-27T00:32:45

1 posts

Out of bounds memory access in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 120.0.6099.224 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T01:40:09.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @h4sh @todb From start of the year until now, a lot of software vendors have tried their darnedest to keep the zero-day exploitation under wraps until they released patches:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti with CVE-2023-46805 (NO PATCHES) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Google Chrome with CVE-2024-0519 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

...I FORGOT HOW CRAZY JANUARY WAS

I'd type more but the ones that stand out were Ivanti, Palo Alto Networks (CVE-2024-3400) and Cisco (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) for confirming unpatched exploited zero-days.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T16:05:20.983Z ##

Fortinet: SmokeLoader Attack Targets Companies in Taiwan
Fortinet reports on a September 2024 campaign targeting Taiwanese companies with SmokeLoader malware. Victims were in manufacturing, healthcare, information technology, and other sectors. The infection chain leverages both CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office and WordPad Remote Code Execution Vulnerability and CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Indicators of compromise provided.

#smokeloader #taiwan #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_1182 #vulnerability #eitw #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #CyberThreatIntelligence #CTI

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-02T16:05:20.000Z ##

The infection chain leverages both CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office and WordPad Remote Code Execution Vulnerability and CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Indicators of compromise provided.

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:18:36.280Z ##

Kaspersky: Analysis of Elpaco: a Mimic variant
Kaspersky provides a malware analysis of a Mimic ransomware variant named Elpaco. The attackers would brute force attack the victim's server via RDP, and leverage the ZeroLogon vulnerability CVE-2020-1472 (vendor 5.5/NVD 10.0 critical) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability before deploying ransomware. It appears to be a Windows based ransomware. Kaspersky provides indicators of compromise, Yara rules, and TTPS mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

#elpaco #mimicransomware #ransomware #malwareanalysis #cve_2020_1472 #zerologon #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #yara #mitreattack #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:18:36.000Z ##

Kaspersky: Analysis of Elpaco: a Mimic variant
Kaspersky provides a malware analysis of a Mimic ransomware variant named Elpaco. The attackers would brute force attack the victim's server via RDP, and leverage the ZeroLogon vulnerability CVE-2020-1472 (vendor 5.5/NVD 10.0 critical) Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability before deploying ransomware. It appears to be a Windows based ransomware. Kaspersky provides indicators of compromise, Yara rules, and TTPS mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

This vulnerability is due to incomplete error checking when parsing an HTTP header. An attacker cou
