screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T01:40:09.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @h4sh @todb From start of the year until now, a lot of software vendors have tried their darnedest to keep the zero-day exploitation under wraps until they released patches:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti with CVE-2023-46805 (NO PATCHES) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Google Chrome with CVE-2024-0519 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

...I FORGOT HOW CRAZY JANUARY WAS

I'd type more but the ones that stand out were Ivanti, Palo Alto Networks (CVE-2024-3400) and Cisco (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) for confirming unpatched exploited zero-days.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.488Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T15:11:21.695Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high) Zyxel Multiple Firewalls Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-11680 (9.8 critical) ProjectSend Improper Authentication Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-45727 (7.5 high) North Grid Proself Improper Restriction of XML External Entity (XEE) Reference Vulnerability

#CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.000Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

CVE-2024-2120
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-27T09:30:48

2 posts

The Elementor Website Builder – More than Just a Page Builder plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's Post Navigation widget in all versions up to, and including, 3.20.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T20:23:05.151Z ##

Cisco updated a security advisory from 2014: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance WebVPN Login Page Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

In November 2024, the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) became aware of additional attempted exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild. Cisco continues to strongly recommend that customers upgrade to a fixed software release to remediate this vulnerability.

CVE-2014-2120 (CVSSv2: 4.3 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability was already added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 12 November 2024, with the vendor likely the source of the exploitation evidence.

#cisco #CiscoASA #CVE_2024_2120 #cybersecurity #infosec #vulnerability #eitw #cve #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-02T20:23:05.000Z ##

Cisco updated a security advisory from 2014: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance WebVPN Login Page Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

In November 2024, the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) became aware of additional attempted exploitation of this vulnerability in the wild. Cisco continues to strongly recommend that customers upgrade to a fixed software release to remediate this vulnerability.

CVE-2014-2120 (CVSSv2: 4.3 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability was already added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 12 November 2024, with the vendor likely the source of the exploitation evidence.

CVE-2024-1147
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-21T09:31:18

2 posts

Weak access control in OpenText PVCS Version Manager allows potential bypassing of authentication and download of files.

1 repos

https://github.com/TheN00bBuilder/cve-2024-11477-writeup

appinn@pullopen.xyz at 2024-11-28T10:17:03.000Z ##

『7-Zip 爆高危漏洞，可远程执行代码，尽快更新至 24.08 版本』
著名的开源压缩/解压缩工具 7-ZIP 爆出一个高危漏洞 CVE-2024-11477，存在于 7-Zip 的 Zstandard 解压缩功能中，它允许攻击者在用户打开恶意压缩包时执行远程代码。该漏洞
……
阅读全文： :sys_link: https://www.appinn.com/7-zip-cve-2024-11477/

#小众软件

##

CVE-2023-48788
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 71.08%

updated 2024-03-19T09:30:32

2 posts

A improper neutralization of special elements used in an sql command ('sql injection') in Fortinet FortiClientEMS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.2, FortiClientEMS 7.0.1 through 7.0.10 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted packets.

1 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2023-48788

malmoeb at 2024-12-06T20:28:52.515Z ##

Who actively monitors the Application Event Log for the Event ID 15457, containing the string xp_cmdshell?

The screenshot below is from an Incident Response engagement this year from an exploited FortiClient EMS server (CVE-2023-48788).

xp_cmdshell spawns a Windows command shell and passes in a string for execution but is disabled by default. For an attacker to abuse this feature, which is present in Microsoft SQL databases, it must be enabled first. Thus leaving a trace in the event log.

Searching through our datalake from all our customers, there is no single hit for the last month for this Event ID and the xp_cmdshell string. This might be a nice, almost zero FP alert. Sigma rule here:

https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma/blob/6fd57da13139643c6fe3e4a23276ca6ae9a6eec7/rules/windows/builtin/application/mssqlserver/win_mssql_xp_cmdshell_change.yml

##
malmoeb@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-06T20:28:52.000Z ##

Who actively monitors the Application Event Log for the Event ID 15457, containing the string xp_cmdshell?

The screenshot below is from an Incident Response engagement this year from an exploited FortiClient EMS server (CVE-2023-48788).

xp_cmdshell spawns a Windows command shell and passes in a string for execution but is disabled by default. For an attacker to abuse this feature, which is present in Microsoft SQL databases, it must be enabled first. Thus leaving a trace in the event log.

Searching through our datalake from all our customers, there is no single hit for the last month for this Event ID and the xp_cmdshell string. This might be a nice, almost zero FP alert. Sigma rule here:

https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma/blob/6fd57da13139643c6fe3e4a23276ca6ae9a6eec7/rules/windows/builtin/application/mssqlserver/win_mssql_xp_cmdshell_change.yml

##

CVE-2023-46805
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 95.78%

updated 2024-01-31T05:07:17

1 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability in the web component of Ivanti ICS 9.x, 22.x and Ivanti Policy Secure allows a remote attacker to access restricted resources by bypassing control checks.

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T01:40:09.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots @h4sh @todb From start of the year until now, a lot of software vendors have tried their darnedest to keep the zero-day exploitation under wraps until they released patches:

  • 1/10/2024: Ivanti with CVE-2023-46805 (NO PATCHES) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Citrix with CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549: https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX584986-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549?language=en_US
  • 1/16/2024: Google Chrome with CVE-2024-0519 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_16.html
  • 1/19/2024: Mandiant says China (UNC3886) exploited VMware CVE-2023-34048 as far back as late 2021: https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021/
  • 1/22/2024: Apple is aware of a report that this issue (CVE-2024-23222) may have been exploited. https://support.apple.com/en-us/120311
  • 1/31/2024: Ivanti drops CVE-2024-21887 and first set of patches for Ivanti Connect Secure/Pulse Secure https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

...I FORGOT HOW CRAZY JANUARY WAS

I'd type more but the ones that stand out were Ivanti, Palo Alto Networks (CVE-2024-3400) and Cisco (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) for confirming unpatched exploited zero-days.

##

CVE-2023-34048
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 5.17%

updated 2024-01-31T05:07:15

1 posts

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

##

CVE-2023-30545
(7.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2023-11-11T05:02:16

2 posts

### Impact It is possible for a user having access to the SQL Manager (Advanced Options -> Database) to arbitrary read any file on the Operating system when using SQL function LOAD_FILE in a SELECT request. So It can access to critical information. ### Patches The patch will be on PS 8.0.4 and PS 1.7.8.9

1 repos

https://github.com/drkbcn/lblfixer_cve_2023_30839

faker at 2024-11-25T17:11:14.346Z ##

I really wish there were more CVSS example ratings.
In the "Common Vulnerability Classes" section of the examples there is a "SQL injection" issue[1]. Great!
Maybe you'd be as surprised as me to see it rated under CVSS3.1 with only 6.5/medium?
That's because it's "kind of"-SQL injection. Here is the description:

> [...] it is possible for a user with access to the SQL Manager (Advanced Options -> Database) to arbitrarily read any file on the operating system when using SQL function `LOAD_FILE` in a `SELECT` request. [...]

Is that REALLY the most common SQLi scenario? Come on!

[1] https://www.first.org/cvss/v4.0/examples#SQL-Injection-CVE-2023-30545

##
faker@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-25T17:11:14.000Z ##

I really wish there were more CVSS example ratings.
In the "Common Vulnerability Classes" section of the examples there is a "SQL injection" issue[1]. Great!
Maybe you'd be as surprised as me to see it rated under CVSS3.1 with only 6.5/medium?
That's because it's "kind of"-SQL injection. Here is the description:

> [...] it is possible for a user with access to the SQL Manager (Advanced Options -> Database) to arbitrarily read any file on the operating system when using SQL function `LOAD_FILE` in a `SELECT` request. [...]

Is that REALLY the most common SQLi scenario? Come on!

[1] https://www.first.org/cvss/v4.0/examples#SQL-Injection-CVE-2023-30545

CVE-2023-27532
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 2.29%

updated 2023-03-16T18:30:29

2 posts

Vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication component allows encrypted credentials stored in the configuration database to be obtained. This may lead to gaining access to the backup infrastructure hosts.

3 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2023-27532

https://github.com/puckiestyle/CVE-2023-27532-RCE-Only

https://github.com/sfewer-r7/CVE-2023-27532

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T16:02:37.330Z ##

The DFIR Report: The Curious Case of an Egg-Cellent Resume
The DFIR Report provides a case study of an ongoing more_eggs malware campaign run by the financially motivated TA4557/FIN6 cybercrime group. This was investigated in March 2024, with the initial access being resume lure (TA4557 modus operandi). CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Veeam Backup missing authentication vulnerability is leveraged. The DFIR Report notes that several leaked hostnames are linked to Fog ransomware attacks as reported by Arctic Wolf. Indicators of compromise, sigma and Yara rules provided.

#ta4557 #FIN6 #more_eggs #CVE_2023_27532 #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware #cybercrime #IOC #yara #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #CyberThreatIntelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-02T16:02:37.000Z ##

The DFIR Report: The Curious Case of an Egg-Cellent Resume
The DFIR Report provides a case study of an ongoing more_eggs malware campaign run by the financially motivated TA4557/FIN6 cybercrime group. This was investigated in March 2024, with the initial access being resume lure (TA4557 modus operandi). CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Veeam Backup missing authentication vulnerability is leveraged. The DFIR Report notes that several leaked hostnames are linked to Fog ransomware attacks as reported by Arctic Wolf. Indicators of compromise, sigma and Yara rules provided.

#ta4557 #FIN6 #more_eggs #CVE_2023_27532 #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware #cybercrime #IOC #yara #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #CyberThreatIntelligence #CTI

CVE-2017-17215
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 62.32%

updated 2023-02-02T05:08:25

2 posts

Huawei HG532 with some customized versions has a remote code execution vulnerability. An authenticated attacker could send malicious packets to port 37215 to launch attacks. Successful exploit could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

4 repos

https://github.com/1337g/CVE-2017-17215

screaminggoat at 2024-11-26T15:14:48.322Z ##

Aqua Security: Matrix Unleashes A New Widespread DDoS Campaign
A threat actor named Matrix (who AquaSec believes to be an amateur or script kiddie) is conducting a new and widespread Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) campaign. Aqua assesses that Matrix is financially motivated despite "strong signs of Russian affiliation (or at least crafting that perception)" due to the absence of Ukrainian targeting. The threat actor is actively targeting both development and production servers. Aqua describes Matrix's exploitation of vulnerabilities and misconfigurations, potential targeting list, GitHub repository of botnet and tools, and advertising of DDoS services. Indicators of compromise listed, and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

Note: CVE-2022-30075, CVE-2018-9995, CVE-2017-17215, CVE-2017-17106 are not in the KEV Catalog yet.

#matrix #ddos #ddosaas #scriptkiddie #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI #mitreattack #ioc #vulnerability #eitw #iot #botnet #activeexploitation #mirai

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-11-26T15:14:48.000Z ##

Aqua Security: Matrix Unleashes A New Widespread DDoS Campaign
A threat actor named Matrix (who AquaSec believes to be an amateur or script kiddie) is conducting a new and widespread Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) campaign. Aqua assesses that Matrix is financially motivated despite "strong signs of Russian affiliation (or at least crafting that perception)" due to the absence of Ukrainian targeting. The threat actor is actively targeting both development and production servers. Aqua describes Matrix's exploitation of vulnerabilities and misconfigurations, potential targeting list, GitHub repository of botnet and tools, and advertising of DDoS services. Indicators of compromise listed, and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

Note: CVE-2022-30075, CVE-2018-9995, CVE-2017-17215, CVE-2017-17106 are not in the KEV Catalog yet.

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 8.48%

updated 2023-02-02T05:01:06

2 posts

Credentials for Zivif PR115-204-P-RS V2.3.4.2103 Webcams can be obtained by an unauthenticated remote attacker using a standard web /cgi-bin/hi3510/param.cgi?cmd=getuser HTTP request. This vulnerability exists because of a lack of authentication checks in requests to CGI pages.

##

CVE-2017-11882
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.44%

updated 2023-02-01T05:03:36

2 posts

Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3, Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2, Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1, and Microsoft Office 2016 allow an attacker to run arbitrary code in the context of the current user by failing to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11884.

34 repos

screaminggoat at 2024-12-02T16:05:20.983Z ##

Fortinet: SmokeLoader Attack Targets Companies in Taiwan
Fortinet reports on a September 2024 campaign targeting Taiwanese companies with SmokeLoader malware. Victims were in manufacturing, healthcare, information technology, and other sectors. The infection chain leverages both CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office and WordPad Remote Code Execution Vulnerability and CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Indicators of compromise provided.

#smokeloader #taiwan #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_1182 #vulnerability #eitw #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #CyberThreatIntelligence #CTI

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-02T16:05:20.000Z ##

Fortinet: SmokeLoader Attack Targets Companies in Taiwan
Fortinet reports on a September 2024 campaign targeting Taiwanese companies with SmokeLoader malware. Victims were in manufacturing, healthcare, information technology, and other sectors. The infection chain leverages both CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office and WordPad Remote Code Execution Vulnerability and CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Indicators of compromise provided.

#smokeloader #taiwan #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_1182 #vulnerability #eitw #IOC #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #CyberThreatIntelligence #CTI

##

CVE-2020-0401(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-01-29T05:04:35

2 posts

In setInstallerPackageName of PackageManagerService.java, there is a missing permission check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege and granting spurious permissions with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-8.0 Android-8.1 Android-9 Android-10 Android-11Android ID: A-150857253

2 repos

https://github.com/nanopathi/framework_base_AOSP10_r33_CVE-2020-0401

https://github.com/Satheesh575555/frameworks_base_AOSP10_r33_CVE-2020-0401

_r_netsec at 2024-12-06T09:58:06.401Z ##

##

CVE-2020-0238(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-01-29T05:03:41

2 posts

In updatePreferenceIntents of AccountTypePreferenceLoader, there is a possible confused deputy attack due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege and launching privileged activities with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-8.1 Android-9 Android-10 Android-8.0Android ID: A-15094663

screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T15:28:54.180Z ##

Veeam security advisory 03 December 2024: Veeam Service Provider Console Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42448 | CVE-2024-42449)

  • CVE-2024-42448 (9.9 critical) remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-42449 (7.1 high) NTLM hash leak of the VSPC service account and file deletion

No mention of exploitation. This is not Veeeam backup and replication (see parent toot above)

#veeam #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T15:28:54.000Z ##

Veeam security advisory 03 December 2024: Veeam Service Provider Console Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42448 | CVE-2024-42449)

  • CVE-2024-42448 (9.9 critical) remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-42449 (7.1 high) NTLM hash leak of the VSPC service account and file deletion

No mention of exploitation. This is not Veeeam backup and replication (see parent toot above)

##

CVE-2024-45727
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.488Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.000Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked 🔺 "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2026-12340

N/A

todb at 2024-12-01T14:59:24.379Z ##

@buherator That’s a nice bit of CVE lore! We should make these more obvious and prominent than a single blog post.

And yes, having a small set of always-valid-but-test CVEs would be nice to publish. That’s a neat idea.

Hey would it be cool to make them Luhn-formula-like so you can detect truncation?

Something like

CVE-2024-12342
CVE-2025-12343
CVE-2026-12340

(all the digits add up to modulo 0)

cc @zmanion

##
